commit_message:
Add basic Zuul layout for ara-clients, ara-plugins, ara-server

These projects don't have any formal jobs yet as they are brand new.
We'll eventually add jobs and remove noop as we iterate to get this
going.

Change-Id: I3402a4a4a4260368f602419d586bb6c06c6ff3d4

commit_message:
Gate: disable ubuntu multinode voting gate.

This PS disables the multinode ubuntu gate from voting, which has
been failing due to -infra issues - and severly hampering development
work as a result.

Change-Id: I411ebe20ba19c52475b559952712faf742343673

commit_message:
Modify failed tripleo validations log file name

This patch renames the failed tripleo validations log file to avoid a lot of
confusion, some people do sometimes, with the validate simple role result.

Change-Id: I9e6cb3219a2e9a6beb31ca9b50a061893ea875c2
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-03-29 03:57:46.000000000', 'message': 'Enable warnings as errors for docs builds

The tox -e docs command is not running the same build
as what is run in the check.  Warnings as errors is
enabled in the check.  This change makes our local
doc builds run the same way.

Change-Id: I5536a663e6e56eaa2e481dfccb0733b7e480f6c3
'}]
commit_message:
Enable warnings as errors for docs builds

The tox -e docs command is not running the same build
as what is run in the check.  Warnings as errors is
enabled in the check.  This change makes our local
doc builds run the same way.

Change-Id: I5536a663e6e56eaa2e481dfccb0733b7e480f6c3

commit_message:
Add non-voting job nodepool-functional-py35-gentoo-src

This adds non-voting job to both diskimage-builder and glean. Start
with non-voting because we don't know how often the job might timeout
due to network.

Change-Id: If1ea07df662309bea1973d025844ff4a4907a959
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556661
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Add ability to delegate where wheels/venvs are stored
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-28 21:58:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-28 22:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-03-29 14:35:44.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nAs discussed, let's rather get rid of the wheel sync and orchestrate in a playbook instead of the role."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 21:58:55.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to delegate where wheels/venvs are stored

In order to allow the use of a delegated host to store
the wheels/venvs, and perhaps to serve the wheels via
pypiserver (or by some other means), we implement the
ability in this patch.

The ability to synchronize the wheels to the delegated
host is made optional. The synchronization to/from the
deployment host is removed as that is unlikely to ever
be used practically.

Change-Id: If10aa1569afcd53d405cd6216e3a3931a13bac2f
'}, {'created': '2018-03-28 22:01:22.000000000', 'message': 'Add ability to delegate where wheels/venvs are stored

In order to allow the use of a delegated host to store
the wheels/venvs, and perhaps to serve the wheels via
pypiserver (or by some other means), we implement the
ability in this patch.

The ability to synchronize the wheels to the delegated
host is made optional. The synchronization to/from the
deployment host is removed as that is unlikely to ever
be used practically.

Change-Id: If10aa1569afcd53d405cd6216e3a3931a13bac2f
'}]
commit_message:
Add ability to delegate where wheels/venvs are stored

In order to allow the use of a delegated host to store
the wheels/venvs, and perhaps to serve the wheels via
pypiserver (or by some other means), we implement the
ability in this patch.

The ability to synchronize the wheels to the delegated
host is made optional. The synchronization to/from the
deployment host is removed as that is unlikely to ever
be used practically.

Change-Id: If10aa1569afcd53d405cd6216e3a3931a13bac2f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 18:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Do without copying wheels around when building on localhost

There are use-cases where the deployment host would be used
to do the venv builds, and when doing so it makes no sense
to have two copies of the wheels.

As such, when localhost and the target host are the same,
we implement a symlink for the wheel directory to the wheel
cache so that the wheels can still be re-used, but they do
not need to be copied back-and-forth.

Using this mechanism keeps the interfaces the same (look
in both paths and the wheels can be found), achieves the
same goal (faster wheel builds), and is very simple.

Change-Id: I64c66d95d5a218385c14fe5016b28ce7ccc4f4e0
'}]
commit_message:
Do without copying wheels around when building on localhost

There are use-cases where the deployment host would be used
to do the venv builds, and when doing so it makes no sense
to have two copies of the wheels.

As such, when localhost and the target host are the same,
we implement a symlink for the wheel directory to the wheel
cache so that the wheels can still be re-used, but they do
not need to be copied back-and-forth.

Using this mechanism keeps the interfaces the same (look
in both paths and the wheels can be found), achieves the
same goal (faster wheel builds), and is very simple.

Change-Id: I64c66d95d5a218385c14fe5016b28ce7ccc4f4e0

commit_message:
Omit default_schedule_zone if its not configured

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/551324
- https://review.openstack.org/554925

There are cases where the default AZ is not called 'nova' in
a single AZ environment.  This patch adds the default behavior
of Nova by leaving it empty if it's not used.

For deployers that are using it, it will be added so this
should not break them.

Change-Id: Iacaa9785bf7ec7bebe2e0eb69e304bcfab41df5c
(cherry picked from commit 3de3c3797591be416964bcf80ef6668bf44ca0de)

commit_message:
Remove nova-manage db from pre_upgrade

nova-manage db was added by f4db8c8012a0336b1a365f5c84509c6077c22a88 to perform
M>N upgrade. Since then nova-manage db online_data_migrations works without any
problems so we don't need to run nova-manage db in pre_upgrade step.

Change-Id: Id790380c9bf9377e342e0e8a8a525c5ce6e9f4b9

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Remove the '[build_sphinx]' and '[pbr]' sections as described in:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128594.html

Change-Id: I31dc268d810fd0ddd69a819b925226787da96ebd

commit_message:

With I5103b4331a8d7c5660848fc148ebe4139ce6dad9 devstack has settled on
etcd 3.2, which has ARM64 binaries.  Thus we should no longer need
this workaround.

commit_message:
Change memcache_pool_socket_timeout to a float

It's not unusual to set 0.25 as a socket_timeout value, and this was
not possible. This can have a dramatic impact for performance when one
memcached server is down, especially when keystone is involved.

Change-Id: Idff7938b82cd7fee9f849d394b8c66f6c2611b0a
Partial-Bug: #1731921

commit_message:
Switch upgrade test to non-voting

The upgrade test is currently failing due to the test
implementation, rather than a failure to upgrade. The
issue is that UCA for pike is implemented and packages
are installed from there, before the ocata UCA replaces
it and installs other packages. The mixed set is not
compatible with the version of libvirt-python that needs
to be built.

Until we can fix the job, let's allow other patches to
merge.

Change-Id: I349c39be84a360b4560fb6683d0e209cd18e85e7
(cherry picked from commit 13bbca5c232ae528b09ff7c51b0524ace268a27a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 21:24:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix ansible-lint job

The ansible-linter was only running on playbooks, not on roles. This
patch corrects the tox environment to ensure that roles are linted.

Since roles weren't being linted, some errors had sneaked through. This
patch also corrects an unnamed task and disables linting of a task that
deliberately uses the shell module.

Also fix a comment in the tox file that was referencing a non-existent
zuul job.

Change-Id: I5b1ca3947e80588ab0cc8d3632f1292fc707aac1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ansible-lint job

The ansible-linter was only running on playbooks, not on roles. This
patch corrects the tox environment to ensure that roles are linted.

Since roles weren't being linted, some errors had sneaked through. This
patch also corrects an unnamed task and disables linting of a task that
deliberately uses the shell module.

Also fix a comment in the tox file that was referencing a non-existent
zuul job.

Change-Id: I5b1ca3947e80588ab0cc8d3632f1292fc707aac1

commit_message:
Allow force-delete even if task_state is not None

As of now, if vm task_state is not 'None', and user tries
to force-delete instance, then he gets HTTP 500 Error
and instance deletion doesn't progress.

The same is not the case, when user tries with delete api
instead of force-delete api, even if vm task_state is not 'None'.

Fixed the issue by allowing force-delete to delete instance
in task_state other than None.

Change-Id: Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e
Closes-Bug: #1741000
(cherry picked from commit 0d2031a5c408ef5919387c680eeaac68709a0f6c)

@Matt Riedemann,

Does it break Pike? What do you propose?'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-03-29 13:43:00.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Fun times, so it turns out that the TripleO undercloud upgrade CI job in question was jumping from Pike to Rocky where new dependencies where introduced (namely Heat) in order to containerise the undercloud during the upgrade. This pulled in oslo-db causing the issue.

Obviously Pike to Rocky isn't a valid upgrade path and this isn't seen between TripleO Pike to Queens upgrades so there's no need to backport this."}]

I9c918828ce9f7075a4e33a6fbadd9613c81fa2eb Nova only removed the use of

commit_message:
Remove usage of kwarg retry_on_request in API

As Retry on request is always enabled in class wrap_db_retry, so in the
new release, kwarg retry_on_request is deprecated for removal in oslo.db.

NOTE(lyarwood): While this was depreacted in Ocata by
I3c53b5c8ba99f460153256fb2e1e6ef01b67f41b before removal in Queens by
I9c918828ce9f7075a4e33a6fbadd9613c81fa2eb Nova only removed the use of
retry_on_request in Queens. As the deprecation actually defaults to
using retry_on_request we can backport this to Pike to avoid issues seen
by TripleO when using Pike Nova with Queens Oslo.db.

Change-Id: Ic98f8cfeb6f78a7e066613787e7cbcea02fcec5c
Closes-Bug: #1715270
(cherry picked from commit 409d7db21e2d7faf0bbf76f982a3403c79897e4f)

commit_message:
Ingress - Add configmap hashes to deployments

- Add annotations for all four configmaps:
   - configmap-conf
   - configmap-bin
   - configmap-udp-services
   - configmap-tcp-services
  to both the error pages and controller deployments
  so that pods restart on conf changes.

Change-Id: Ica0e296553816cf31d79316f0111a31ea31d62b6

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4a4ca9726fab1d0cf9a33311201b7f65951a0942
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add endpoint_type and auth_version config option

Prior to their removal from the tempest repository, the heat tests
supported an endpoint_type option[1] to configure which endpoint
interface to use in its requests to the Orchestration service and other
OpenStack services. This patch adds back this support so that users can
configure the heat tests to run against non-public interfaces.

Added auth_version in the config option as devstack auth_url does
not have auth_version.

Backported from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530460/

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/544254/ addd heat_plugin/endpoint_type
in ceilometer telemetry integration tests. It is leading to failing
the tests as above param is not available in in tree heat tempest plugin.
It fixes the above issue.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/tempest/config.py?h=17.2.0#n943

Change-Id: I3642f65bd2888583b3b674b3d31b5e385baf66e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 18:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Update systemd service for longer TimeoutStopSec

This patch updates the default systemd service definition for the Octavia
processes. It increases the TimeoutStopSec to 300 seconds to allow more time
for the in-flight flows (failover, etc.) to finish and gracefully shutdown.
If the cloud has performance issues, flows may run beyond their normal
sub-minute runtime.

Change-Id: I5708c05db2c9f13491f5af0cd0b8c5632c537608
(cherry picked from commit b1d02c6ba90dbeed2e564afcf886f29b8b37e51c)
'}]
commit_message:
Update systemd service for longer TimeoutStopSec

This patch updates the default systemd service definition for the Octavia
processes. It increases the TimeoutStopSec to 300 seconds to allow more time
for the in-flight flows (failover, etc.) to finish and gracefully shutdown.
If the cloud has performance issues, flows may run beyond their normal
sub-minute runtime.

Change-Id: I5708c05db2c9f13491f5af0cd0b8c5632c537608
(cherry picked from commit b1d02c6ba90dbeed2e564afcf886f29b8b37e51c)

commit_message:
Extract log level from syslog

By default the syslog input plugin won't extract the
log level from a syslog message. By setting the priority
key, the log level is extracted.

Partial-Bug: #1725240
Change-Id: I9ad5f5e1c875ef62b39fbbba7b271d98cee68dd6
(cherry picked from commit c8984ca355649a27446d8198151bf2989159b8a3)

commit_message:
Run all scenario in parallel

We stopped running all scenarios in parallel,
which leads to longer job times and less concurrent test run.

The full parallel run had too high failure rate,
this job is supposed to prove it is possible to return back to
the old way. If the issue(s) are still exists it will
produce usable artifacts for further debugging.

Change-Id: I776ebb7761d90d2490cf49f9df9b322c2b34da59

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 19:18:56.000000000', 'message': 'HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA deployment after upgrade

During major upgrade, ensure that the haproxy bundle exposes
the HAProxy stats socket by ensuring there is a bind mount of
/var/lib/haproxy from the host.

Also create /var/lib/haproxy on the host with host_prep_tasks,
and make sure that permissions will be set by Kolla init
at next container restarts.

Depends-On: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55
Change-Id: I0923375fef9f392d3692afb50b21fee7b57c3ca0
'}]
commit_message:
HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA deployment after upgrade

During major upgrade, ensure that the haproxy bundle exposes
the HAProxy stats socket by ensuring there is a bind mount of
/var/lib/haproxy from the host.

Also create /var/lib/haproxy on the host with host_prep_tasks,
and make sure that permissions will be set by Kolla init
at next container restarts.

Depends-On: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55
Change-Id: I0923375fef9f392d3692afb50b21fee7b57c3ca0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 07:07:15.000000000', 'message': "[Docs] Adapt the wording for disk requirements

Disks requirements aren't clear, and people can think it's
always required to have 1TB disk on cinder nodes. There is no
hard requirement there, so we should remove this requirement,
mark it as recommendation, and point its only for LVM backends.

Change-Id: Ic45a7799e5092653d70fce9f2b6b7ae3f03d8775
(cherry picked from commit 62bbe0f38e04864e3e669fb0871ddacefca79814)
"}]
commit_message:
[Docs] Adapt the wording for disk requirements

Disks requirements aren't clear, and people can think it's
always required to have 1TB disk on cinder nodes. There is no
hard requirement there, so we should remove this requirement,
mark it as recommendation, and point its only for LVM backends.

Change-Id: Ic45a7799e5092653d70fce9f2b6b7ae3f03d8775
(cherry picked from commit 62bbe0f38e04864e3e669fb0871ddacefca79814)

rpc collector

active-active Collector service, detached from vitrage-graph service,
 exposing it's methods by RPC, so to only run when needed.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 09:24:51.000000000', 'message': "Switch upgrade test to non-voting

The upgrade test is currently failing due to the test
implementation, rather than a failure to upgrade. The
issue is that UCA for queens is implemented and packages
are installed from there, before the pike UCA replaces
it and installs other packages. The mixed set is not
compatible with the version of libvirt-python that needs
to be built.

Until we can fix the job, let's allow other patches to
merge.

Change-Id: I349c39be84a360b4560fb6683d0e209cd18e85e7
"}, {'created': '2018-03-01 17:51:13.000000000', 'message': "Switch upgrade test to non-voting

The upgrade test is currently failing due to the test
implementation, rather than a failure to upgrade. The
issue is that UCA for queens is implemented and packages
are installed from there, before the pike UCA replaces
it and installs other packages. The mixed set is not
compatible with the version of libvirt-python that needs
to be built.

Until we can fix the job, let's allow other patches to
merge.

Change-Id: I349c39be84a360b4560fb6683d0e209cd18e85e7
"}]
commit_message:
Switch upgrade test to non-voting

The upgrade test is currently failing due to the test
implementation, rather than a failure to upgrade. The
issue is that UCA for queens is implemented and packages
are installed from there, before the pike UCA replaces
it and installs other packages. The mixed set is not
compatible with the version of libvirt-python that needs
to be built.

Until we can fix the job, let's allow other patches to
merge.

Change-Id: I349c39be84a360b4560fb6683d0e209cd18e85e7

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:42:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I11c8526b413e6dfc6e2457026ccc2f35e38d1699
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use a common python build/install role for source-base deployment

Instead of copying a common set of code between all the roles,
switch to using a common role which checks whether a deploy host
already has the appropriate venv package. If it does not, build
it on the fly and pull it to the deploy host.

Implementing this does away with the requirement to do builds
on the repo container. Once this has been implemented into all
roles then the repo_build role will be retired.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/556840
Change-Id: I57e87406bee5c7d10aa824f18d3142f8f3ac6ab4

commit_message:
Migrate tempest-dsvm-cells job to an in-tree job definition

This defines the nova-cells-v1 job, based the tempest-dsvm-cells
job from openstack-zuul-jobs.

The branch override parts of the job definition are removed since
the job will be defined per-branch now (we'll also have to backport
this to stable/queens).

There will be related changes to project-config, devstack, tempest
and openstack-zuul-jobs on this topic branch to use the new job name.

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Conflicts:
      .zuul.yaml

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to change
I8630ea11c3067ed934de2ef27a63432418e98c33 not being in Queens.

Change-Id: I25c87f27c69e0cdb74e8553305a09cb85f43d87e
(cherry picked from commit 6435b3745a603fde53da41716fdcfc1b743583b4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 18:35:59.000000000', 'message': "Always deallocate networking before reschedule if using Neutron

When a server build fails on a selected compute host, the compute
service will cast to conductor which calls the scheduler to select
another host to attempt the build if retries are not exhausted.

With commit 08d24b733ee9f4da44bfbb8d6d3914924a41ccdc, if retries
are exhausted or the scheduler raises NoValidHost, conductor will
deallocate networking for the instance. In the case of neutron, this
means unbinding any ports that the user provided with the server
create request and deleting any ports that nova-compute created during
the allocate_for_instance() operation during server build.

When an instance is deleted, it's networking is deallocated in the same
way - unbind pre-existing ports, delete ports that nova created.

The problem is when rescheduling from a failed host, if we successfully
reschedule and build on a secondary host, any ports created from the
original host are not cleaned up until the instance is deleted. For
Ironic or SR-IOV ports, those are always deallocated.

The ComputeDriver.deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method defaults
to False just so that the Ironic driver could override it, but really
we should always cleanup neutron ports before rescheduling.

Looking over bug report history, there are some mentions of different
networking backends handling reschedules with multiple ports differently,
in that sometimes it works and sometimes it fails. Regardless of the
networking backend, however, we are at worst taking up port quota for
the tenant for ports that will not be bound to whatever host the instance
ends up on.

There could also be legacy reasons for this behavior with nova-network,
so that is side-stepped here by just restricting this check to whether
or not neutron is being used. When we eventually remove nova-network we
can then also remove the deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method and
SR-IOV check.

Change-Id: Ib2abf73166598ff14fce4e935efe15eeea0d4f7d
Closes-Bug: #1597596
(cherry picked from commit d25c5dfd60059cc33dd61e27a58ee114049ce518)

means unbinding any ports that the user provided with the server
create request and deleting any ports that nova-compute created during
the allocate_for_instance() operation during server build.

When an instance is deleted, it's networking is deallocated in the same
way - unbind pre-existing ports, delete ports that nova created.

The problem is when rescheduling from a failed host, if we successfully
reschedule and build on a secondary host, any ports created from the
original host are not cleaned up until the instance is deleted. For
Ironic or SR-IOV ports, those are always deallocated.

The ComputeDriver.deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method defaults
to False just so that the Ironic driver could override it, but really

Looking over bug report history, there are some mentions of different

in that sometimes it works and sometimes it fails. Regardless of the
networking backend, however, we are at worst taking up port quota for
the tenant for ports that will not be bound to whatever host the instance
ends up on.

There could also be legacy reasons for this behavior with nova-network,
so that is side-stepped here by just restricting this check to whether
or not neutron is being used. When we eventually remove nova-network we
can then also remove the deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method and

Change-Id: Ib2abf73166598ff14fce4e935efe15eeea0d4f7d
Closes-Bug: #1597596
(cherry picked from commit 3a503a8f2b934f19049531c5c92130ca7cdd6a7f)

commit_message:
Always deallocate networking before reschedule if using Neutron

When a server build fails on a selected compute host, the compute
service will cast to conductor which calls the scheduler to select
another host to attempt the build if retries are not exhausted.

With commit 08d24b733ee9f4da44bfbb8d6d3914924a41ccdc, if retries
are exhausted or the scheduler raises NoValidHost, conductor will
deallocate networking for the instance. In the case of neutron, this
means unbinding any ports that the user provided with the server
create request and deleting any ports that nova-compute created during
the allocate_for_instance() operation during server build.

When an instance is deleted, it's networking is deallocated in the same
way - unbind pre-existing ports, delete ports that nova created.

The problem is when rescheduling from a failed host, if we successfully
reschedule and build on a secondary host, any ports created from the
original host are not cleaned up until the instance is deleted. For
Ironic or SR-IOV ports, those are always deallocated.

The ComputeDriver.deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method defaults
to False just so that the Ironic driver could override it, but really
we should always cleanup neutron ports before rescheduling.

Looking over bug report history, there are some mentions of different
networking backends handling reschedules with multiple ports differently,
in that sometimes it works and sometimes it fails. Regardless of the
networking backend, however, we are at worst taking up port quota for
the tenant for ports that will not be bound to whatever host the instance
ends up on.

There could also be legacy reasons for this behavior with nova-network,
so that is side-stepped here by just restricting this check to whether
or not neutron is being used. When we eventually remove nova-network we
can then also remove the deallocate_networks_on_reschedule() method and
SR-IOV check.

Change-Id: Ib2abf73166598ff14fce4e935efe15eeea0d4f7d
Closes-Bug: #1597596
(cherry picked from commit 3a503a8f2b934f19049531c5c92130ca7cdd6a7f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 15:52:18.000000000', 'message': 'Handle EndpointNotFound when building image_ref_url in notifications

Change I4e755b9c66ec8bc3af0393e81cffd91c56064717 made the
[glance]/api_servers option optional. If not set, we attempt
to get the image service endpoint via keystoneauth adapter and
the service catalog via the request context.

Periodic tasks run without an actual token so there is no way
to get the service catalog and the KSA adapter code to get the
endpoint raises EndpointNotFound when trying to build the
"image_ref_url" entry in the legacy instance notification payload.

This change simply handles the EndpointNotFound and sets the
image_ref_url to the instance.image_ref, which for non-volume-backed
instances is the image id (for volume-backed instances it's an empty
string).

This doesn't affect versioned notifications since those don't use the
"image_ref_url" entry in the payload that is created, they just have
an "image_uuid" entry in the versioned notification payload which is
populated via instance.image_ref.

An upgrade impact release note is added in the case that some consuming
service is actually relying on that legacy notification field being
a URL and parsing it as such. The thinking here, however, is this is
better than not sending the field at all, or setting it to None.

Long-term this code all gets replaced with versioned notifications.

Change-Id: Ie23a9c922776b028da0720c939846cba233ac472
Closes-Bug: #1753550
(cherry picked from commit 6482165bb1f44f5c98d9361153d737c22c92112d)
'}]
commit_message:
Handle EndpointNotFound when building image_ref_url in notifications

Change I4e755b9c66ec8bc3af0393e81cffd91c56064717 made the
[glance]/api_servers option optional. If not set, we attempt
to get the image service endpoint via keystoneauth adapter and
the service catalog via the request context.

Periodic tasks run without an actual token so there is no way
to get the service catalog and the KSA adapter code to get the
endpoint raises EndpointNotFound when trying to build the
"image_ref_url" entry in the legacy instance notification payload.

This change simply handles the EndpointNotFound and sets the
image_ref_url to the instance.image_ref, which for non-volume-backed
instances is the image id (for volume-backed instances it's an empty
string).

This doesn't affect versioned notifications since those don't use the
"image_ref_url" entry in the payload that is created, they just have
an "image_uuid" entry in the versioned notification payload which is
populated via instance.image_ref.

An upgrade impact release note is added in the case that some consuming
service is actually relying on that legacy notification field being
a URL and parsing it as such. The thinking here, however, is this is
better than not sending the field at all, or setting it to None.

Long-term this code all gets replaced with versioned notifications.

Change-Id: Ie23a9c922776b028da0720c939846cba233ac472
Closes-Bug: #1753550
(cherry picked from commit 6482165bb1f44f5c98d9361153d737c22c92112d)

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

commit_message:
do not use tools/tox_install.sh for docs

Using tools/tox_install.sh for docs is (a) not needed
and (b) breaks doc publication in the 'post' gate.

Change-Id: I3ef7c0f3d606086c159e1bdfc3cf05a3025d28e2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-24 16:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-24 16:57:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I added unit test command to lower-constraints env.

In addition, horizon no longer supports Django 1.8 but we forgot to bump the minimum version. I post a patch to bump the minimum Django version https://review.openstack.org/556047 .'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-24 16:59:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Even after that, somehow most unit tests in horizon and openstack_dashbaord are not run. I don't know the reason of that, but horizon team needs to investigate why most tests are not run. http://logs.openstack.org/91/555491/2/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/72b4a02/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-24_16_57_18_503857

I think this should be explored separately."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-25 17:19:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Even after that, somehow most unit tests in horizon and openstack_dashbaord are not run. I don't know the reason of that, but horizon team needs to investigate why most tests are not run. http://logs.openstack.org/91/555491/2/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/72b4a02/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-24_16_57_18_503857
> I think this should be explored separately.

The cause turns out nose-exclude==0.3.0. In u-c, we use 0.5.0. It seems 0.4.0 and 0.4.1 work too, but this is a module for testing, so I think we can bump the minimum version to nose-exclude>=0.5.0.

I haven't understood yet what is the right process to bump the minimum version after lower-constraints.txt is introduced."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-25 18:54:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Even after that, somehow most unit tests in horizon and
 > openstack_dashbaord are not run. I don't know the reason of that,
 > but horizon team needs to investigate why most tests are not run.
 > http://logs.openstack.org/91/555491/2/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/72b4a02/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-24_16_57_18_503857
 > > I think this should be explored separately.
 > 
 > The cause turns out nose-exclude==0.3.0. In u-c, we use 0.5.0. It
 > seems 0.4.0 and 0.4.1 work too, but this is a module for testing,
 > so I think we can bump the minimum version to nose-exclude>=0.5.0.
 > 
 > I haven't understood yet what is the right process to bump the
 > minimum version after lower-constraints.txt is introduced.

Please feel free to take this patch over and fix any of the constraints that aren't accurate. You will want to update the values in requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt as appropriate at the same time. You may need to add a Depends-On for https://review.openstack.org/555402 in order to allow those files to differ from the global list (until that patch lands and the rule changes)."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-25 19:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1 -Code-Review

Thanks Doug. I will take care of horizon (and related plugins if any).'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-25 19:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-25 19:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-25 23:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-03-26 00:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27809, 'date': '2018-03-26 08:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27153, 'date': '2018-03-26 13:09:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-26 17:48:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2018-03-27 02:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-03-27 08:30:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-03-29 08:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

---

horizon specific change:
* Django minimum version is bumped to >=1.11 as horizon rocky
  dropped Django 1.8-1.10 support.
* django-babel needs to be bumped to 0.6.2 to support Django 2.0
  https://github.com/python-babel/django-babel/commit/8762ff5dc00c4c552655134970c8a261f9bd7366
* nose-exclude needs to be bumped to 0.5.0 to run horizon unit tests
  properly. According to my test, 0.4.0 also works but this is
  a testing dependency, so we don't need to care multiple versions much.
  Otherwise only one test is run for openstack_dashboard unit tests.

https://review.openstack.org/555402 allows us to bump lower requirements.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I73c3e4531c57d015f6016ca00b056a6fd0d8fc1a
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555402
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Signed-off-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Introduce container status 'Dead'

Docker container has the 'Dead' state so we'd better to introduce
a corresponding status in Zun for mapping. This status implies that
the docker daemon tried but failed to stop the container (i.e. due to
some unexpected reasons).

Change-Id: I46ad083e8f89685b1853d1e10cccbfd1c1988de8

commit_message:
Fails to get DPDK feature status.

This change is to get dpdk feature status for a role
when using docker service neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent.yaml file.
DPDK derive params workflow is not invoked and derived
parameters for dpdk role when using docker service
neutron-ovs-dpdk-agent.yaml file for deployment.
_get_role_info workflow is failed to get dpdk feature enabled
status for dpdk role.

Change-Id: I3e878e5dacf8e78710c892309b0d064506ec7345
Closes-Bug: #1759296

commit_message:
Set max_microversion 2.35 for nova tenant network tests

The compute os-tenant-networks API is deprecated from the
Microversion 2.36, so we should set max_microversion = '2.35'
for compute tenant network tests.

ref: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#list-project-networks

Implements blueprint: clear-deprecated-api

Change-Id: I3432f75e100fbeda21404d66f9ab0feeb29931f3

This moves the endpoint_environment setup to be common (instead of being

It also removes the public-tls-undercloud.yaml addition away from being

commit_message:
Remove repeated code from TLS related bits in undercloud_config

This moves the endpoint_environment setup to be common (instead of being
done twice as it was being done before.

It also removes the public-tls-undercloud.yaml addition away from being
common for the TLS setup. It should only be done when certs are being
autogenerated.

Change-Id: I60441576949c484c9274103c1af014ef64893bbf

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ib0948bfba3be14f0068bb3b49d2d356bd36f96b9
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add missing document start "---" to post.yaml
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 6547, 'name': 'Andreas Jaeger', 'email': 'jaegerandi@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaegerandi'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 15334, 'name': 'Stephen Finucane', 'display_name': 'stephenfin', 'email': 'stephenfin@redhat.com', 'username': 'sfinucan'}, {'_account_id': 17765, 'name': 'Frank Kloeker', 'email': 'f.kloeker@telekom.de', 'username': 'eumel8'}, {'_account_id': 20156, 'name': 'Petr Kovar', 'email': 'pkovar@redhat.com', 'username': 'pmkovar'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28000, 'name': 'zhenyang.liang', 'email': 'liangzy@awcloud.com', 'username': 'alvenliang'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-21 12:36:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-03-21 12:49:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thx'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-21 12:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

why is this needed?

Completely unneeded in openstack CI...'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-03-21 14:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> why is this needed?
 > 
 > Completely unneeded in openstack CI...

no yamllint in openstack CI, indeed.

 > why is this needed?
 > 
 > Completely unneeded in openstack CI...

no yamllint in zuul playbooks, indeed. just wondering.
a syntax check would blame the missing document-start ---'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-21 14:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Frank, it works just fine... Zuul does not need that line at all.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-03-22 07:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Frank, it works just fine... Zuul does not need that line at all.

Yes, it works for the moment and in that environment. Maybe sometimes you want to start with yamllint to syntax check the files or someone else wants to run the scripts within a syntax check like in Ansible Tower. --- is the correct syntax (http://www.yaml.org/spec/1.2/spec.html#id2760395) and I think we should follow the standard.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-22 07:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I disagree, we do not need this. The roles in project-config/zuul-jobs etc do not need it - and we use ansible-lint there as well.'}, {'account_id': 28000, 'date': '2018-03-22 07:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-22 16:16:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is --- not part of the yaml spec? I have no strong opinion, I just noticed it.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:04:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> Is --- not part of the yaml spec? I have no strong opinion, I just
 > noticed it.

Maybe. Maybe not. In any case, most other projects don't use this and it seems zuul doesn't need it. Would you mind just abandoning this unless you've a firm reason to keep it? :)"}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-03-27 15:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

After reading the syntax document from Frank, "three dashes" is useful if there would be multiple documents in a yaml file. I think there would be no need to add another document in this yaml file. So, I would like to give my weak -1 here.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:57:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Looks like it would be best to abandon this change, then.'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2018-03-29 07:15:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

let's abandon this one, it is not necessary"}]

Change-Id: I3cb0eb7f0fcec5cf65a68d36b305ccaa0ce98986

I still see value on having dracut-regenerate, or in the case we want to do it as a general process on diskimage-builder, we need to consider other things. Installing a package is not enough to have the ramdisk regenerated properly. There can be modules that are disabled by default, and that need to be activated explicitly using dracut --add or similar command. Also dracut-regenerate could be extended to add drivers as well, because it is a common need (in fact i needed to work on that these days)'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-09-16 17:01:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This patch should not replace dracut-*.

IMHO dracut is used mainly in rpm based systems. Currently dracut is not usable for Ubuntu because of the described problems (today the official Ubuntu package even does not install, because there is a problem with the Ubuntu postinst script.... - so it's obvious that it is not used that much ;-) ).

The methodologies under rpm and deb based look different. E.g. I called 'disk-image-create ... -p lvm2 ...' and the initramfs plugins get picked up without any need to add or configure something.  (Run the update-initramfs once with -v):

    + update-initramfs -u -v
    Available versions: 4.4.0-93-generic
    Keeping /boot/initrd.img-4.4.0-93-generic.dpkg-bak
    update-initramfs: Generating /boot/initrd.img-4.4.0-93-generic
    Copying module directory kernel/drivers/hid
    ...
    Calling hook lvm2
    Adding binary /sbin/dmsetup
    Adding library /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdevmapper.so.1.02.1
    Adding library-link /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6
    Adding library /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm-2.23.so
    Adding binary /sbin/lvm
    Adding library /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdevmapper-event.so.1.02.1
    Adding library-link /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libreadline.so.5
    Adding library /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libreadline.so.5.2
    Adding library-link /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libtinfo.so.5
    Adding library /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libtinfo.so.5.9
    Adding module /lib/modules/4.4.0-93-generic/kernel/drivers/md/dm-bufio.ko
    Adding module /lib/modules/4.4.0-93-generic/kernel/drivers/md/dm-snapshot.ko
    ...

So IMHO this is the way it should be done under Debian / Ubuntu. dracut is currently only usable on rpm based distribution."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-16 23:09:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Markos: can you please give me a hint about the command you
 > executed?
 > (I'm a little bit surprised about your finding, because all the CI
 > jobs worked fine...)

Yep so I did

export DIB_RELEASE=xenial
disk-image-create --no-tmpfs -o deployment_image.qcow2 -t qcow2 -p "vlan,vim,less,bridge-utils,language-pack-en,iputils-ping,rsyslog,curl,iptables,lvm2" ubuntu-minimal vm enable-serial-console simple-init devuser growroot openssh-server

on a Xenial host using the master branch of diskimage-builder

If you can't reproduce it then I will double check...'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-09-21 04:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1 Code-Review-2

Still keeping my +1, as this is a separate issue that might be handled in a follow up patch'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I think I got the root cause:

The lvm local-block script [1] is not able to deal with the root=LABEL=xxx syntax. Replacing 

   root=LABEL=cloudimage-root

with 

  root=/dev/mapper/vg-lv_root

works like a charm!

[1] 

(initramfs) cat scripts/local-block/lvm2
#!/bin/sh

PREREQ="mdadm mdrun multipath"

prereqs()
{
	echo "$PREREQ"
}

case $1 in
# get pre-requisites
prereqs)
	prereqs
	exit 0
	;;
esac

if [ ! -e /sbin/lvm ]; then
	exit 0
fi

lvchange_activate() {
	lvm lvchange -aay -y --sysinit --ignoreskippedcluster "$@"
}

activate() {
	local dev="$1"

	case "$dev" in
	/dev/mapper/*)
		eval $(dmsetup splitname --nameprefixes --noheadings --rows "${dev#/dev/mapper/}")
		if [ "$DM_VG_NAME" ] && [ "$DM_LV_NAME" ]; then
			lvchange_activate "$DM_VG_NAME/$DM_LV_NAME"
		fi
		;;

	/dev/*/*)
		# Could be /dev/VG/LV; use lvs to check
		if lvm lvs -- "$dev" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
			lvchange_activate "$dev"
		fi
		;;
	esac
}

activate "$1"

exit 0'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2018-02-05 15:25:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2018-03-27 07:55:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Would it be possible to move this patch forward? Without it the initramfs is not being rebuild automatically. (It only happens if a element explicitly triggers it)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-27 09:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

ok, sorry it was not on my radar cause it had the -1.   but it seems like plenty of people have tested this in various other contexts, so seems safe to move forward with'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-29 04:15:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
debootstrap: Call update-initramfs explicitly

Many elements install additional distribution packages.
In addition the user can provide a set of packages to be installed
via the '-p' switch.
Some of them influence the boot process and therefore the initramfs
needs to be updated. Because the package manager during the image
creation process is configured not to run package scripts, this needs
to be done explicitly.

This issue was found during development and debugging of the
block-device LVM plugin: Even when the e.g. the lvm2 package
was installed in the image, it was missing in the initramfs
because of the missing update.

Change-Id: I7c92033b3ca80cdd23d081002059d83ca3f53bdb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 07:52:45.000000000', 'message': 'HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA deployment after upgrade

During major upgrade, ensure that the haproxy bundle exposes
the HAProxy stats socket by ensuring there is a bind mount of
/var/lib/haproxy from the host.

Also create /var/lib/haproxy on the host with host_prep_tasks,
and make sure that permissions will be set by Kolla init
at next container restarts.

Depends-On: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55
Change-Id: I0923375fef9f392d3692afb50b21fee7b57c3ca0
'}]
commit_message:
HAProxy: expose stats socket in HA deployment after upgrade

During major upgrade, ensure that the haproxy bundle exposes
the HAProxy stats socket by ensuring there is a bind mount of
/var/lib/haproxy from the host.

Also create /var/lib/haproxy on the host with host_prep_tasks,
and make sure that permissions will be set by Kolla init
at next container restarts.

Depends-On: Ib833ebe16fcc1356c9e0fc23a7eebe9c4b970c55
Change-Id: I0923375fef9f392d3692afb50b21fee7b57c3ca0

add lower-constraints job

bounds of the dependencies.

in those tests.

for more details.

add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

for more details.

commit_message:
Explicitly read setup.cfg as utf-8 on Python 3

Per the referenced bug, relying on the terminal encoding to read
setup.cfg is not safe.  Unfortunately, Python 2 doesn't accept an
encoding when reading config files so we need a fallback path for
that version.

Change-Id: If49344db2f9139c0557f6acd17671163e02468a5
Closes-Bug: 1745396

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4bf5b081d630414cdd8beb7fd322aeb6fd90d7d7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

This PS udpates the frequency and initial delay on the mons
livenessProbe, to allow time for the cluster to restart if mons
get into a crashloop backoff following power outage.

Change-Id: Iea74c4d52882a157a84f4f12bc411f2014869f99
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph: Increase period between livenessProbe checks

This PS udpates the frequency and initial delay on the mons
livenessProbe, to allow time for the cluster to restart if mons
get into a crashloop backoff following power outage.

Change-Id: Iea74c4d52882a157a84f4f12bc411f2014869f99

commit_message:
Migrate to stestr

stestr is actively maintained. OpenStack is migrating to stestr,
go ahead.

Remove the depend on python-subunit as well. stestr takes care of
that for us

Change-Id: I6f845ab4ef1a1c91048666614799a03ab02ab765

[{'created': '2017-08-29 01:42:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add a [[ checker

This adds a basic check for [[ when using non-POSIX comparisions such
as =~, <, >.  This is a fairly common typo often not picked up until
runtime.  Since it's usually part of an "if [ $foo =~ bar ]; then"
statement it doesn't trigger "-e" and the failure just falls through.

As mentioned in the code; this is one of those things that starts
requiring a complete bash parser to get 100% right.  However, I
believe this detects the most common failures without setting off
false alarms.

Change-Id: I5478032800cdf175cb10ce25dc8b6afce6ebd0dd

commit_message:
Add a [[ checker

This adds a basic check for [[ when using non-POSIX comparisions such
as =~, <, >.  This is a fairly common typo often not picked up until
runtime.  Since it's usually part of an "if [ $foo =~ bar ]; then"
statement it doesn't trigger "-e" and the failure just falls through.

As mentioned in the code; this is one of those things that starts
requiring a complete bash parser to get 100% right.  However, I
believe this detects the most common failures without setting off
false alarms.

Change-Id: I5478032800cdf175cb10ce25dc8b6afce6ebd0dd

commit_message:
Change the GENTOO_PORTAGE_CLEANUP variable default

Default the GENTOO_PORTAGE_CLEANUP to True.  By default we should not
ship package info, this bloats the image and is usually outdated by the
time it'd be consumed.

Change-Id: I14c2530d91807cbc6a3806e01c7e4f6f472b190d

commit_message:
zypper-minimal: Set default locale env to C.UTF-8

Currently in Leap 42.x the bootup scripts don't actually make use of
locale.conf yet, so we need to set it in /etc/sysconfig/language. For
future distro compatibility the setting in locale.conf is kept in sync.

Also fix default timezone link.

Change-Id: I59e5dccad8a5ae132d3039851e7aa1db86a609d7

Now I think about it ... would like greghaynes to confirm

I guess we do not want to be in the long-term game of being a provider of system python, so I agree with this.  That said, I'm not sure there is a way to write a script that works universally -- bare xenial will only have python3 ... centos has no python3 ..."}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2017-04-12 19:26:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Something I would worry about is that I imagine some things reference this symlink within the image. e.g. I think if you make a venv using dib-python it will end up referencing this symlink. We could go the route of saying 'do not use this in a way which will depend on the symlink after usage' but IMO that just puts some burden on to our devs so there needs to be a good argument for why we want it gone in the first place?"}, {'account_id': 10035, 'date': '2017-04-12 19:42:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

ok, so after learning about the history (maybe worth adding to the commit msg) about how this is a response to dib-python in venvs causing breakage I grok a bit more of the motivation.

IMO I would still leave the symlink - it shouldnt actively hurt anything, and removing state after an image build but before boot just adds some extra complexity for devs to reason about. Some things we could do to mitigate this issue though are:

* move the symlink to somewhere very obtuse and add it to our PATH during image creation. e.g. /usr/share/dib-tools/dib-python.
* document in README as clarkb mentions that this symlink isnt to be used and is primarily meant for internal dib usage. If you plan to use it know the caveats that this can break venvs and generally be weary.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-04-12 21:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The other thing I thought was that dib-python could maybe munge the path to include some dib util functions.  for example, we have a whole bunch of different was of executing and tracing subprocesses ... each of which is fraught with corner cases.  doing it once would be good.

that might work better with dib-python being off the $PATH

i did add a note on it to the docs here

I also added $DIB_PYTHON here with I88ad3c9eb958d58db4631d9b27bc2c592f970345.  The idea being that dib-python is only for #! (because it doesn't expand $vars) but to call "python script.py", or, i guess, make a virtualenv with --python, use that var; it will point to the right system python'}, {'account_id': 6908, 'date': '2017-04-21 21:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-05-01 07:34:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Greg -- i think we should remove this and leave this as an internal thing.  i'd not be opposed to moving it to some non-path location too, that way it is explictly only called via #! scripts that really want it

if no other opinions i'll merge before next release"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-06-02 04:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-02 05:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Clean up dib-python symlink

We only need dib-python when we build the image, no need to leak it to
the final product.  Remove it in cleanup.d outside the chroot so
nothing can be using it.

Change-Id: I1e229caad7968fb3ab8e44ecdda427e174088d2d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0906638c2fd77dbdcff56ffc43e5c3b70ca729f5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Re-use env var for setting the test branch

Given that run_tests.sh automatically figures out the
branch being tested based on .gitreview, let's re-use
that environment variable so that the branch setting
is self-managing.

Change-Id: I53811527a450e8b2ea8f83e708d21049513e634e

commit_message:
Remove the lacp bond mode constraints

As all the known issues have been fixed already in RHEL and ovs,
remove the constraint to avoid lacp bond mode configuration.
Closes-Bug: #1757382

Change-Id: Idaa871b46b7e9cd7a5d502f7865d946183f8d750

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed. The exterior role is built to be OSA compatible and may be pulled
into tree should we deem it necessary.

Change-Id: Ie558875fcfbcd92c38d55e2d24087fce90889eaf
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2017-07-27 04:19:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use load-edit directive in import key pair

To be convenient to import key, this patch enables to load key from
file using load-edit directive.

Since load-edit directive is Angular module, this patch is effective
only in Angularized Launch Instance workflow.

Change-Id: I25ad0f61fb95826939a452cc4504bafaebc29766

'}, {'created': '2017-08-31 05:28:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use load-edit directive in import key pair

To be convenient to import key, this patch enables to load key from
file using load-edit directive.

NOTE:
Since load-edit directive is Angular module, this patch is effective
only in Angularized Launch Instance workflow. Also, this does not

commit_message:
Use load-edit directive in import key pair

To be convenient to import key, this patch enables to load key from
file using load-edit directive.

NOTE:
Since load-edit directive is Angular module, this patch is effective
only in Angularized Launch Instance workflow. Also, this does not
works for "Import Key Pair" action on Django-based Key Pairs panel.

Change-Id: I25ad0f61fb95826939a452cc4504bafaebc29766

revisions:

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4279572d8eff5434c997717e5cb973afdce97de8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4279572d8eff5434c997717e5cb973afdce97de8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix ironic inspector public endpoint

Fixes a bug where the Baremetal Introspection service's public endpoint
registered in the Identity service referenced the internal API endpoint.

Also updates keystone endpoints for the Baremetal and Baremetal
Introspection services during reconfigure and upgrade operations.
Previously this was only done during deploy.

Change-Id: I32d475f288bb4a3834c13cc86f0c53b5437c3d25
Closes-Bug: #1738418

commit_message:
Fix element-provides in debian element

The debian element depends on debian-minimal now which provides
operating-system. This means that the debian element can no longer
provide operating-system and doing so results in an error when using the
debian element.

The fix is simple just rely on the fact that debian-minimal provides
operating-system and remove this element-provides from debian.

Fixes-Bug: 1758000
Change-Id: I524feeb82c19046ec987eb1186c7f4568309e559

commit_message:
libvirt: mask InjectionInfo.admin_pass

Logging network information and the admin password
for guest instances is not ideal, so let's not do it.

Change-Id: I328ba88b128c6c125e65d850ed7a6e57049dc7e2
Closes-Bug: #1737207
(cherry picked from commit 6839630e86d958dcda8585664586754d419363a7)
(cherry picked from commit 088bf6df8ee332f1c24493430003a5bf1b77b2ce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-28 09:28:31.000000000', 'message': "Handle spawning error on unshelving

If spawning fails when unshelving, terminate the volumes' connections
with the node, and remove the node reference from the instance entry.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts are due to the following changes not in Pike:

commit_message:
Handle spawning error on unshelving

If spawning fails when unshelving, terminate the volumes' connections
with the node, and remove the node reference from the instance entry.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py

NOTE(mriedem): Conflicts are due to the following changes not in Pike:

  I391554d3904a5a60b921ef4714a1cfd0a64a25c2

  If38e4a6d49910f0aa5016e1bcb61aac2be416fa7

  I00eab47edf1150788777300680e853a872c1db40

Closes-Bug: 1627694
Change-Id: I8cfb2280d956d452ccad1fc711bd814b7258147f
(cherry picked from commit dcdd2c9832c7c60fe9163cd744ca2b5acfe16bcc)
(cherry picked from commit 73c3e4969c108f2eefc77b57021d9b3e17afdc8e)

commit_message:
Remove osprofiler tests

This commit removes running the single osprofiler test on this branch.
This interferes with running unit tests with the --failing flag. Since
we can't backport the stestr migration, which would fix this issue,
because of requirements this just removes that test command. The value
of the osprofiler tests is not as much as being able to use --failing.

Change-Id: I2aaa16867a31a34896c2b9faa44c06b84c2ff17d

Previously user was getting a 500 error code for ComputeHostNotFound
if they are using latest microversion that does live migration in
async. This patches changes return response to 400 as 500 internal
server error should not be returned to the user for failures due to

closes-bug:1643623

'}]
commit_message:
Return 400 when compute host is not found

Previously user was getting a 500 error code for ComputeHostNotFound
if they are using latest microversion that does live migration in
async. This patches changes return response to 400 as 500 internal
server error should not be returned to the user for failures due to
user error that can be fixed by changing to request on client side.

Change-Id: I7a9de211ecfaa7f2816fbf8bcd73ebbdd990643c
closes-bug:1643623
(cherry picked from commit fb68fd12e2fd6e9686ad45c9875508bd9fa0df91)

commit_message:
docs: Disable smartquotes

This change should then allow all configuration examples to be copied
from the docs directly into nova.conf without resulting in Unicode
errors when these options are then parsed.

Note that this option is deprecated and replaced in Sphinx 1.6.6 [1] by
the smartquotes configurable. A future change will need to land to
switch between these, for now we will use and backport the
html_use_smartypants option.

[1] http://www.sphinx-doc.org/en/stable/config.html#confval-smartquotes

Change-Id: I6c47a0d74e5b5a03bc030a7e45cc7783f22ddadf
Closes-bug: #1755783
(cherry picked from commit 75fc30090133c31316e6ae790568f1b622807d0c)

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in get

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of GET in SchedulerReportClient.

Conflicts:
  nova/scheduler/client/report.py
  nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/test_report_client.py
  nova/tests/unit/scheduler/client/test_report.py

NOTE(takashin):
  The conflicts are due to Iab366da7623e5e31b8416e89fee7d418f7bf9b30.
  This patch should have been merged to stable/queens before
  Iab366da7623e5e31b8416e89fee7d418f7bf9b30!

Change-Id: I306ac6f5c6b67d77d91a7ba24d4d863ab3e1bf5c
Closes-Bug: #1734625
(cherry picked from commit ab4efbba61fb0dd0266e42e48555f80ddde72efd)

commit_message:
Ensure the JSON-Schema covers the legacy v2 API

Similar to change Ie165b2a79efd56a299d2d4ebe40a6904a340414f,
these were some other APIs missing 2.0 for the query schema
lower-bound which means v2.0 requests weren't getting validated
by the schema.

Change-Id: I1b0fc5dfd424b42e381e5c3b703cf7473b9fcbcb
Related-Bug: #1701451
(cherry picked from commit 7db20191206be454175e069cab08107a8c4fbe6f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 06:06:17.000000000', 'message': "Allow force-delete even if task_state is not None

As of now, if vm task_state is not 'None', and user tries
to force-delete instance, then he gets HTTP 500 Error
and instance deletion doesn't progress.

The same is not the case, when user tries with delete api
instead of force-delete api, even if vm task_state is not 'None'.

Fixed the issue by allowing force-delete to delete instance
in task_state other than None.

Change-Id: Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e
Closes-Bug: #1741000
(cherry picked from commit 0d2031a5c408ef5919387c680eeaac68709a0f6c)
"}, {'created': '2018-03-06 14:45:00.000000000', 'message': "Allow force-delete even if task_state is not None

to force-delete instance, then he gets HTTP 500 Error

The same is not the case, when user tries with delete api

Fixed the issue by allowing force-delete to delete instance

Change-Id: Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e

commit_message:
Allow force-delete even if task_state is not None

As of now, if vm task_state is not 'None', and user tries
to force-delete instance, then he gets HTTP 500 Error
and instance deletion doesn't progress.

The same is not the case, when user tries with delete api
instead of force-delete api, even if vm task_state is not 'None'.

Fixed the issue by allowing force-delete to delete instance
in task_state other than None.

Change-Id: Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e
Closes-Bug: #1741000
(cherry picked from commit 0d2031a5c408ef5919387c680eeaac68709a0f6c)

commit_message:
FFU: Fix gnocchi FFU tasks

We need to register facts in order to stop overriding values on
skipping.

Change-Id: I250c8774dd146a99732b5407a52e983b6342bad8
(cherry picked from commit a4a6fb71c52884885d2186d58d2a50706ddf1ac0)

commit_message:
Implement MasqueradeNetworks services

To port what has been done in instack-undercloud, we need a new service
to manage IPtables rules when we need to redirect network through the
undercloud via masquerading.
It was done in instack-undercloud via bash, it'll now be done in THT via
a service, disabled by default and that will be activated in CI when
deploying with a containerized undercloud.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Herve <therve@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ic9a2626e73d132c3be7ff14a1f4cdba0c16c5b53
Change-Id: I93ff9a3bebcec1bc7ee188f9ec00feafca2c5117

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I0ad0aa3533d324a46289920efb9ad637cbcf37f7
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Rename auth_details key from swift3 to s3api
messages:
[{'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-03-28 08:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-03-28 22:53:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

Nice! Looks like the only lingering references to the string "swift3" in *code* (as opposed to comments or docstrings) are to do with sysmeta, which I'd really hesitate to change since it'd break data on disk that was created with swift3.

Swauth (and any other alternate auth systems) will need to learn about the new key, and probably tolerate both until they can drop support for swift3.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 08:25:09.000000000', 'message': "Rename auth_details key from swift3 to s3api

This should NOT be an impact on upgrading because the request environ
key is prepared for each request. It's nice that s3api is in swift upstream
repo because we can resolve this issue with only ONE commit at once.

Change-Id: I87e964e2dd0c72d07f4f43b357bc7b0ee6cf4360
"}]
commit_message:
Rename auth_details key from swift3 to s3api

This should NOT be an impact on upgrading because the request environ
key is prepared for each request. It's nice that s3api is in swift upstream
repo because we can resolve this issue with only ONE commit at once.

Change-Id: I87e964e2dd0c72d07f4f43b357bc7b0ee6cf4360

commit_message:
Change compute mgr placement check to region_name

Change https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492247/ in queens deprecated the
[placement]/os_region_name config option and you should be using
'region_name' in that group now, and you'll get a deprecation warning if
using 'os_region_name', but if you do that, nova-compute fails to start.

This patch fix the bug by adding [placement]/region_name to the check.

Change-Id: Iea7d5d0d6907adbcb236dc43b5af7469de2ba78b
Closes-Bug: #1757273
(cherry picked from commit be9854b0fdff22a72a9699a0900e53e0595bd533)

commit_message:
Use constants for cinder-backup and cinder-schedule

Since it has defined constants.SCHEDULER_BINARY/TOPIC and
constants.BACKUP_BINARY/TOPIC, this patch change some
cinder scheduler and backup strings to use
constans.SCHEDULER_BINARY/TOPIC and constants.BACKUP_BINARY/TOPIC.

Change-Id: I98bfb8366adf6ae8c04fa8a5f1c36e17a9ffa52e

subject: add lower-constraints job

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-23 21:28:40.000000000', 'message': 'add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I60c542e73a276f3aec9da4d5b8f3a38a9a2d8ae0
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Ensure misplaced objects are included when cleaving a shard
messages:
[{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-26 14:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

different solution in https://review.openstack.org/557547'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 14:06:37.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure misplaced objects are included when cleaving a shard

Before, when cleaving a shard, only objects that fell within a
destination shard range were cleaved. Any misplaced objects *may* have
been dealt with by a previous invocation of the misplaced objects
handler, but that was not guaranteed.

With this change the first and last shard ranges cleaved will be
extended to include all objects below or above their lower or upper
limits respectively.

Change-Id: I808f786be7ca2b846e56754ac3cce2a54451ca69
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure misplaced objects are included when cleaving a shard

Before, when cleaving a shard, only objects that fell within a
destination shard range were cleaved. Any misplaced objects *may* have
been dealt with by a previous invocation of the misplaced objects
handler, but that was not guaranteed.

With this change the first and last shard ranges cleaved will be
extended to include all objects below or above their lower or upper
limits respectively.

Change-Id: I808f786be7ca2b846e56754ac3cce2a54451ca69

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 16:56:10.000000000', 'message': "Gate: run ironic tests in the regular multinode job

We don't specify any regex for this job, so it runs some tests.
They only include test_network_basic_ops, which does not check that
multitenancy is in effect. We have a test for it in ironic-tempest-plugin,
but it does not run anywhere. There is a neutron test for the same,
but it's not a smoke test and it has been skipped for quite some time.

This change switches this job to the run the following tests:
* all ironic tests (that are not skipped for any reason)
* multinode tests from Nova

Unfortunately, this patch uncovers that we don't run any tests for
network attach/detach in practice. The devstack plugin has to be updated
first to support more than one port per node. A TODO is left in the playbook.

Change-Id: I46d94c29f858977604c0a3430257eca2bee977e3
(cherry picked from commit 5f03daf21f705a1002a4e06393b803005a8921cd)
"}]
commit_message:
Gate: run ironic tests in the regular multinode job

We don't specify any regex for this job, so it runs some tests.
They only include test_network_basic_ops, which does not check that
multitenancy is in effect. We have a test for it in ironic-tempest-plugin,
but it does not run anywhere. There is a neutron test for the same,
but it's not a smoke test and it has been skipped for quite some time.

This change switches this job to the run the following tests:
* all ironic tests (that are not skipped for any reason)
* multinode tests from Nova

Unfortunately, this patch uncovers that we don't run any tests for
network attach/detach in practice. The devstack plugin has to be updated
first to support more than one port per node. A TODO is left in the playbook.

Change-Id: I46d94c29f858977604c0a3430257eca2bee977e3
(cherry picked from commit 5f03daf21f705a1002a4e06393b803005a8921cd)

The systemd conversion change for bootstrap-hosts brought in some
unrelated storage changes as well, which include a change to how
get_instance_info is reported.

Unfortunately the changed get_instance_info assumes btrfs/zfs are

The fix fences the get_instance_info zfs/btrfs related reports to

commit_message:
Fix get_instance_info from systemd conversion

The systemd conversion change for bootstrap-hosts brought in some
unrelated storage changes as well, which include a change to how
get_instance_info is reported.

Unfortunately the changed get_instance_info assumes btrfs/zfs are
always present, which is incorrect and breaks the integrated gate[1].

The fix fences the get_instance_info zfs/btrfs related reports to
run only if the associated binaries are present.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/94/556994/1/check/openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_lxc-ubuntu-xenial/dff3675/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-03-28_19_12_56_259857

Change-Id: I47ddd59af136dab45922f907bfd6b338fd7777bb

commit_message:
Only su within container if container_user is provided

Instead of always su - container_user -c /bin/sh.....

Now it will only pass su if container_user is set, otherwise the
execution will begin at /bin/sh inside the container.

Change-Id: I50ff0f0788855115c8bae3cb5fe5eabb4e2d74b1

Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

(cherry picked from commit f494c6f2d475bfc936b78fda7ce11ed4d46c7224)

commit_message:
Fix Angular errors in openstack_auth

Angular errors on login page are caused by loading ngdetails view.
Although registration of URL for ngdetails is executed on top level
of Horizon, ngdetails view is not needed to be loaded in login page,
i.e. openstack_auth side.
To fix this issue, this patch moves registration of URL for ngdetails
into openstack_dashboard side.

Change-Id: Ib039417b4e666c2341f17ac05fd7723bc758816c
Closes-Bug: #1754133
Closes-Bug: #1753557
(cherry picked from commit f494c6f2d475bfc936b78fda7ce11ed4d46c7224)

[{'created': '2018-03-28 17:33:33.000000000', 'message': 'base-test: Move validate-host before configure-unbound

We are seeing issues with configure-unbound being able to detect ipv6
ansible variables. Since we actually write our facts to disk in
validate-host, lets do it first. This should then mean any ipv6

'}]
commit_message:
base-test: Move validate-host before configure-unbound

We are seeing issues with configure-unbound being able to detect ipv6
ansible variables. Since we actually write our facts to disk in
validate-host, lets do it first. This should then mean any ipv6
variables have been loaded into ansible, and if we still have issues
perhaps we are hitting a bug in Ansible.

Change-Id: Iee265e64894d992de5c841ab54bfd2b889e1715b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Spawn/stop metadata proxies upon adding/deleting router interfaces

When a network becomes isolated and isolated_metadata_enabled=True, the DHCP
agent won't spawn the required metadata proxy instance unless the agent gets
restarted. Similarly, it won't stop them when the network is no longer
isolated.

This patch fixes it by updating the isolated metadata proxy on port_update_end
and port_delete_end methods which are invoked every time a router interface
port is added, updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I5c197a5755135357c6465dfe4803019a2ad52c14
Closes-Bug: #1753540
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from 9362d4f1f21df2a27c818bb0c2918241eb67e3d0)

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
