This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run

Change-Id: I44eda16e7d222e4d83f26e78c4e933edd0a7271b
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for feature/policy-refactor

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I44eda16e7d222e4d83f26e78c4e933edd0a7271b

commit_message:
Add Fullstack gate failure rate to neutron dashboard

As fullstack job is added to gate queue in neutron,
this patch adds also graph with failure rate of this job to
neutron-failure-rate dashboard

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/557218
Change-Id: I1c278ab70a6147ed18edc9ff2ae875ec28460a16

commit_message:
Add a gate using lower-constraints

We have found that some of the requirements.txt values do not match the
required minimum versions for Octavia. This patch adds a tox environment and
a non-voting gate to test patches against the current requirements.txt
minimum versions.

Change-Id: I4c44327d4997af1e7b9caa8a6b5659a88925557a

proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535806/ as an alternative that does not require use of a custom fixture. I'd prefer to do things the standard way unless there's a reason not to. E.g., if you can demonstrate performance issues with that alternative.

That also covers cases that do not appear to be covered here.

And this appears to touch some tests with non-autospec changes. Those changes don't fit here with the current commit message."}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:03:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

As per our discussion [1], mock.create_autospec does the same thing I'm trying to do, but it has a higher performance impact than the way I'm trying to solve it, and in some cases, mock.create_autospec can have really a really bad performance. I've also included a concrete example in our discussion.

As for the non-autospec changes you've mentioned, you're probably referring to test_rbd. TBH, I'm not really sure how they worked until now, especially since before, in setUp, it was setting self.mock_rbd = mock_rbd (where mock_rbd is the argument passed by @mock.patch.object) and setting all sorts of properties onto self.mock_rdb, but mock_rbd would become invalid after setUp finished, because that's how the @mock.patch decorator works. The same applies with mock_rados. At the very least, it's simplifying and cleaning up the unit tests in test_rbd.py at least.

But the main reason why I changed test_rbd.py is because some assertions were failing with this patch because the unit tests were making assertions upon different mocks.

For example, test_uncloneable_unreadable. It setting the following side_effect:

    mock_proxy.side_effect = mock_rbd.Error

In which mock_rbd is a mock passed the unit test's @mock.patch decorator. But mock_rdb is not an Exception. It is not the Exception set in the setUp, as I've explained previously. No idea how the unit tests passed until now.

I guess I'll include this explanation in the commit message as well then.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2018-01-19.log.html#t2018-01-19T16:05:19"}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-01-25 18:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-03-20 13:45:34.000000000', 'message': "POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

Change-Id: I3636833962c905faa0f144c7fdc4833037324d31
"}, {'created': '2017-03-20 13:50:17.000000000', 'message': "POC: tests: autospecs all the mock.patch usages

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

NOTE: the current released version of mock does not support all of these,
thus, an unreleased version of mock is used for this POC.

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

NOTE: the current released version of mock does not support all of these,
thus, an unreleased version of mock is used for this POC.

By default, mock.patch's autospec argument is None, meaning that
there's no signature checking for the patched methods and funtions.

Wraps mock.patch methods to pass in a default autospec=True argument,
if not already given.
Adds unit test to verify that the newly wrapped mock.patch methods work
as intended.

NOTE: the current released version of mock does not support all of these,
thus, an unreleased version of mock is used for this POC.

Until now, mock.Mock did not receive any autospec argument, yet
there are a few tests which are using it.

The autospec argument is being added by a fixture, and some unit
tests are not using it properly.

NOTE(claudiub): This patch also includes changes to test_rbd, which
simplifies and cleans up the unit tests. In its setUp, it was setting
self.mock_rbd = mock_rbd (where mock_rbd is the argument passed by
@mock.patch.object) and setting all sorts of properties onto
self.mock_rbd, but mock_rbd would become invalid after setUp finished,
as the mock.patch decorator would remove the patched mock. The same
applies with mock_rados.

Depends-On: I0e4a55fbf4c1d175726ca22b664e240849a99856

commit_message:
tests: fixes mock autospec usage

Until now, mock.Mock did not receive any autospec argument, yet
there are a few tests which are using it.

The autospec argument is being added by a fixture, and some unit
tests are not using it properly.

Depends-On: I0e4a55fbf4c1d175726ca22b664e240849a99856

Partial-Bug: #1735588

Change-Id: I3636833962c905faa0f144c7fdc4833037324d31

subject: Blacklist libvirt-python 4.1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-26 20:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8726, 'date': '2018-03-27 06:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-28 04:19:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2018-03-28 05:16:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Shouldn't bifrost install the system package for libvirt-python to match the used libvirt version?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-28 20:19:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I think it is acceptable to install newer python bindings for libvirt (whether that's better than installing the system provided one is not clear to me)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-26 20:44:00.000000000', 'message': 'Blacklist libvirt-python 4.1.0

This version consumes undeclared variables such as:

  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_PERSIST_XML
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DISKS_PORT
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_LEVEL
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_THREADS
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_DTHREADS
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_XBZRLE_CACHE
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INITIAL
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INCREMENT

Bifrost installs it via virtualbmc [1]

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/prepare_libvirt.yml#n134

Change-Id: Ie804057835a6d245848d284fa9fdfc6d6fa6765b
Closes-Bug: #1753539
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>
'}]
commit_message:
Blacklist libvirt-python 4.1.0

This version consumes undeclared variables such as:

  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_PERSIST_XML
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_DISKS_PORT
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_LEVEL
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_THREADS
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_MT_DTHREADS
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_COMPRESSION_XBZRLE_CACHE
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INITIAL
  * VIR_MIGRATE_PARAM_AUTO_CONVERGE_INCREMENT

Bifrost installs it via virtualbmc [1]

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/bifrost/tree/playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/tasks/prepare_libvirt.yml#n134

Change-Id: Ie804057835a6d245848d284fa9fdfc6d6fa6765b
Closes-Bug: #1753539
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Add feature/policy-refactor branch to glance repo

The policy refactoring work will be significant effort touching many
internals of glance codebase. Creating feature branch so we can ensure
that the changes are stable and safe before committing to release them.
This will allow us to conduct the work on smaller increments that are
easier to digest.

Change-Id: I478c37eacb701e97390f376226db203b4bf3d1c6

commit_message:
Fix help string for subnets option

The option to enable masquerading for the network
is 'masqurade', not 'masquerade_network'.

Change-Id: Icd95d10d18e5dd8b69ca01c98f00d19da123c85d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-14 14:48:23.000000000', 'message': 'Convert role to use a common systemd init role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

In converting this role to use the common systemd_service role a
keystone_service dictionary was created in the defaults main.yml file.
This change follows the pattern of other services.

commit_message:
Convert role to use a common systemd service role

This removes the systemd service templates and tasks from this role and
leverages a common systemd service role instead. This change removes a
lot of code duplication across all roles all without sacrificing features
or functionality. The intention of this change is to ensure uniformity and
reduce the maintenance burden on the community when sweeping changes are
needed.

In converting this role to use the common systemd_service role a
keystone_service dictionary was created in the defaults main.yml file.
This change follows the pattern of other services.

Change-Id: I65902f2483ef2f18ac2d229c5ebd9d090b6ae040
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

messages:
[{'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-03-28 20:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-28 21:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

is there a related upstream bug, or just figured out from empirical evidence?'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-03-28 21:21:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

For those catching up (like me :) ... This is a follow-on to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557458/ which moved fact gathering for networks earlier -- when that didn't work as expected it revealed this issue.  it would still probably be good to point or file an upstream issue"}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-03-28 21:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 20:45:27.000000000', 'message': "base-test: use gather_subset: network for ansible 2.3

It seems gather_subset: !all,network doesn't work on 2.3, but does on
2.4. Since our executors are only 2.3, switch to this syntax. In
locally testing this works as expected.

Change-Id: Ie3e04e8f1e8e8ce09632274d20609c6c9e665a04
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
base-test: use gather_subset: network for ansible 2.3

It seems gather_subset: !all,network doesn't work on 2.3, but does on
2.4. Since our executors are only 2.3, switch to this syntax. In
locally testing this works as expected.

Change-Id: Ie3e04e8f1e8e8ce09632274d20609c6c9e665a04
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add fact to get array of nic alias name

This is useful for getting the alias name of
a real network interface name which in turn
will allow users to configure alias name in tht.

Change-Id: I28fae19f8c1c8dacad38d10513330b15bd6cdbe6

bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4730050d1a91a82c11164ae180a636cdf6c46feb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I4730050d1a91a82c11164ae180a636cdf6c46feb
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix next_hop for metadata service host route on local_subnet

The host route to the metadata service should use the
undercloud as next_hop when configuring the subnet that
is on the same L2 segment as the undercloud itself. The
code used to manage this was not correctly implemented.

Change-Id: Icf40af8ac424d14386aacda38cf674cc25273fc8
Closes-Bug: #1757418
(cherry picked from commit 73d8effd15d45c28ecababbbca2787c6d152bff8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-09 20:13:12.000000000', 'message': 'pass the fine input to subunit2junitxml

Since python-subunut 1.2, subunit2junitxml expects an input file in the
SubUnit format 2:

  Subunit’s bundled tools accept only version 2 and only emit version 2,
  but the new filters subunit-1to2 and subunit-2to1 can be used to
  interoperate with older third party libraries.

Without any prelimiar conversion, the result will just be an empty XML
file. RHEL ships python-subunit 1.0 so we cannot just unconditionally
use the format 2 input.

Change-Id: Iab98fca8815b38283fdde44605de296d77c46b4f
'}, {'created': '2018-03-19 22:30:57.000000000', 'message': 'pass the fine input to subunit2junitxml

Since python-subunut 1.2, subunit2junitxml expects an input file in the
SubUnit format 2:

  Subunit’s bundled tools accept only version 2 and only emit version 2,
  but the new filters subunit-1to2 and subunit-2to1 can be used to
  interoperate with older third party libraries.

Without any prelimiar conversion, the result will just be an empty XML
file. RHEL ships python-subunit 1.0 so we cannot just unconditionally
use the format 2 input.

Change-Id: Iab98fca8815b38283fdde44605de296d77c46b4f
'}]
commit_message:
pass the fine input to subunit2junitxml

Since python-subunut 1.2, subunit2junitxml expects an input file in the
SubUnit format 2:

  Subunit’s bundled tools accept only version 2 and only emit version 2,
  but the new filters subunit-1to2 and subunit-2to1 can be used to
  interoperate with older third party libraries.

Without any prelimiar conversion, the result will just be an empty XML
file. RHEL ships python-subunit 1.0 so we cannot just unconditionally
use the format 2 input.

Change-Id: Iab98fca8815b38283fdde44605de296d77c46b4f

commit_message:
Fix fluentd upgrade tasks during FFU.

The upgrade task doesn't check for the service existence which make
the upgrade fails during ffu.

We're using the set_facts idiom as it persist between steps.

Closes-Bug: #1757985

Change-Id: I1d3ccd7d3fb641d187f214c20f1d6a4d6113304a
(cherry picked from commit f857e21b2d4633d15f76d25c800e71d6e9b6a99f)

commit_message:
Switch ip link command to pyroute2

This patch switches IpLinkCommand methods from ip_lib
module to use pyroute2 library.

This commit adds also additional link attribute "allmulticast"
thus allowing to make easy functional test for
set_allmulticast_on method from IpLinkCommand class.

Related-Bug: #1492714

Change-Id: I9ffd23c240c607ffd5f10beff5c8c8d5f01441e9

commit_message:
Remove compatibility cruft from overcloud-validate

It was already using the openstack CLI unconditionally in one place, so
let's use it everywhere. This also fixes the documentation link.

Change-Id: Ie510b10429e5d734830d2815212a3ae565914667

commit_message:
allow project requirements to diverge at the lower bounds

Replace the exact match check for requirements with one that ensures
that the exclusion set specified is a subset of any exclusions used in
the global requirements list. This allows the lower bounds in a
project to diverge from the value used in other projects (and the
global list) while still ensuring that the allowed set of values is
the same.

We treat a cap (<version) as an exclusion because we want to allow
caps but we don't want them to be different from what we have in
global-requirements.

Change-Id: Ic2355cf6ca15380025d76dacffcf917c3929d40c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-07 14:44:37.000000000', 'message': 'Save admin password to sysmeta in libvirt driver

We have an API for setting the admin password for an already created
instance and we have a metadata API for retrieving the encrypted
password. In the libvirt driver, when a request to set the admin
password is received, it is indeed set in the guest but the instance
system metadata is never updated with the encrypted password, so
attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc
(cherry picked from commit 715a3cadb07fb92cc11542cfb5001844122b6f60)
'}]
commit_message:
Save admin password to sysmeta in libvirt driver

We have an API for setting the admin password for an already created
instance and we have a metadata API for retrieving the encrypted
password. In the libvirt driver, when a request to set the admin
password is received, it is indeed set in the guest but the instance
system metadata is never updated with the encrypted password, so
attempts to retrieve the password via the metadata service API result
in an empty string returned instead of the encrypted password.

This has been broken in the libvirt driver since the set admin password
password feature was added, as far as I can tell. The xen api driver,
however, handles the same thing correctly and this adds similar logic
to the libvirt driver to fix the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1748544

Change-Id: Icf44c4c94529cb75232abe1f3ecc5a4d3646b0cc
(cherry picked from commit 715a3cadb07fb92cc11542cfb5001844122b6f60)

commit_message:
Add in missing QUEENS tag

The QUEENS tag was not added. This completes the tagging of
the QUEENS DB migrations.

Closes-Bug: #1759234
Change-Id: I17c3ed7711bcc7f72bcf5e8df02d435ed4ba3384

commit_message:
Enable mutable config in Neutron

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
This is only respected when the new method mutate_config_files is
called instead of reload_config_files. Neutron delegates making this
call to oslo.service. This was provided in patchset
Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e

Further patches will be needed to make select config options be
marked as mutable. This change enables support for oslo provided
config options to be updated via SIGHUP such as log level.

Task: 6389
Story: 2001545

Change-Id: I9442965607f3248706464643c6d87a04edcae24e

commit_message:
Removing deprecated module neutron.api.versions

'Versions.factory()' is deprecated in version 'Queens'
and was marked to be removed 'Rocky'.
This patch removes it and switches to use
neutron.pecan_wsgi.app.versions_factory instead.

In addition, neutron.api.versions is removed
because this deprecated module isn't used anywhere.

Change-Id: I08d1725a973c734b55771918915428377fb7d3b4

commit_message:
Add fullstack job to gate queue

Fullstack job's failure rate is reasonable since few weeks,
job is already working as "voting" and there is no problem
with that.
Because of that it is now added also to gate queue.

Change-Id: I346c3c97b26932e2f02893cf5f3b63090cd81ee0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-27 18:38:45.000000000', 'message': "Don't define polling_interval option in two places

The option is currently defined in two places - as a generic agent
option and as a sriov agent specific one. This is a problem now that
oslo.config tracks location where options are defined
(I6dec1e09dcab203c6287f9c56c866f220a42f850) because when unit test
runner imports all modules, it registers the option from those two
separate locations, and since locations are different, it's considered
the options are duplicate, which results in the following error:

DuplicateOptError: duplicate option: polling_interval

To fix the issue, I removed the definition of the option from sriov
module and made sure the common agent options are registered whenever
the sriov module is imported.

Change-Id: I485532692f4b3a5804885e0325a8352fe6b1aa65
Closes-Bug: #1759345
"}]
commit_message:
Don't define polling_interval option in two places

The option is currently defined in two places - as a generic agent
option and as a sriov agent specific one. This is a problem now that
oslo.config tracks location where options are defined
(I6dec1e09dcab203c6287f9c56c866f220a42f850) because when unit test
runner imports all modules, it registers the option from those two
separate locations, and since locations are different, it's considered
the options are duplicate, which results in the following error:

DuplicateOptError: duplicate option: polling_interval

To fix the issue, I removed the definition of the option from sriov
module and made sure the common agent options are registered whenever
the sriov module is imported.

Change-Id: I485532692f4b3a5804885e0325a8352fe6b1aa65
Closes-Bug: #1759345

[{'created': '2018-03-23 20:02:37.000000000', 'message': "Move _make_instance_list call outside of DB transaction context

The _make_instance_list method is used to make an InstanceList object
out of database dict-like instance objects. It's possible while making

@db.select_db_reader_mode decorated _get_by_filters_impl method to the
get_by_filters method to remove the nesting.

(cherry picked from commit b1ed92c7af01a9ac7e122a541ce1bdb9be0524c4)

commit_message:
Move _make_instance_list call outside of DB transaction context

The _make_instance_list method is used to make an InstanceList object
out of database dict-like instance objects. It's possible while making
the list that the various _from_db_object methods that are called might
do their own database writes.

Currently, we're calling _make_instance_list nested inside of a 'reader'
database transaction context and we hit the error:

  TypeError: Can't upgrade a READER transaction to a WRITER
  mid-transaction

during the _make_instance_list call if anything tries to do a database
write. The scenario encountered was after an upgrade to Pike, older
service records without UUIDs were attempted to be updated with UUIDs
upon access, and that access happened to be during an instance list,
so it failed when trying to write the service UUID while nested inside
the 'reader' database transaction context.

This simply moves the _make_instance_list method call out from the
@db.select_db_reader_mode decorated _get_by_filters_impl method to the
get_by_filters method to remove the nesting.

Closes-Bug: #1746509

Change-Id: Ifadf408802cc15eb9769d2dc1fc920426bb7fc20
(cherry picked from commit b1ed92c7af01a9ac7e122a541ce1bdb9be0524c4)

commit_message:
Avoid exploding if guest refuses to detach a volume

When we run detach_volume(), the guest has to respond to the ACPI
eject request in order for us to proceed. It may not do this at all
if the volume is mounted or in-use, or may not by the time we time out
if lots of dirty data needs flushing. Right now, we let the failure
exception bubble up to our caller and we log a nasty stack trace, which
doesn't really convey the reason (and that it's an expected and
reasonable thing to happen).

Thus, this patch catches that, logs the situation at warning level and
avoids the trace.

Change-Id: I3800b466a50b1e5f5d1e8c8a963d9a6258af67ee
Closes-Bug: #1750680
(cherry picked from commit b16c0f10539a6c6b547a70a41c75ef723fc618ce)
(cherry picked from commit 81992142f657a3d71600182935f06efe5f8e8e86)

Avoid exploding if guest refuses to detach a volume

When we run detach_volume(), the guest has to respond to the ACPI
eject request in order for us to proceed. It may not do this at all
if the volume is mounted or in-use, or may not by the time we time out
if lots of dirty data needs flushing. Right now, we let the failure
exception bubble up to our caller and we log a nasty stack trace, which
doesn't really convey the reason (and that it's an expected and
reasonable thing to happen).

avoids the trace.

commit_message:
Fix obtaining env_uuid from deployment

This patch fixes a check for DEPLOYMENT_UUID in case of missing
ENV_UUID. Instead of checking system environment directly, we should
call get_global method which loads our source file with default UUIDs.

Change-Id: I2314b758339edfe77e1536c37dcdb54af1b6a581

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi to break in new and exciting ways. This change pins PBR to the

"}]
commit_message:
Pin PBR to ensure we're not breaking builds

A new version of PBR was released which causes some services, like
gnocchi to break in new and exciting ways. This change pins PBR to the
stable release that was available at the time this version of OpenStack
was developed.

Change-Id: I02458d60602cf4a3fd071780d6a2bd25e273fa29
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 23:11:11.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox from requirements

Mox was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
used anywhere. Since we want to get rid of this package in
OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look
like it is being used.

commit_message:
Remove mox from requirements

Mox was listed in test-requirements, but it is not actually
used anywhere. Since we want to get rid of this package in
OpenStack, removing from requirements so it does not look
like it is being used.

Change-Id: I56b66f83f9b9e3a75b01b21726bebd13451bd9a0

commit_message:
Fix location where backend_host is configured

When the backend_host option is specified, configure it in each
cinder-volume backend driver's section and not in the DEFAULT section.
Backend drivers only look for the option in their backend section, so
setting in the DEFAULT section had no effect.

Clarify the fact that the DEFAULT host option is *not* deprecated, and
is only deprecated in backend sections (where the backed_host should be
used).

Partial-Bug: #1753596
Change-Id: I11a55571f4bed630967242c797e08e11c47eab11
(cherry picked from commit bec1827866f24ad1934b94e8722c7aa3ccf21c7d)

commit_message:
Make it so that service_name can handle Debian

If the value is 'keystone-public-keystone-admin', then the
module will use 2 services, one called keystone-public, and
one called keystone-admin (as per the new Debian package
which uses UWSGI instead of Apache).

Note: the Debian package doesn't do like this *yet*, but
that is planned for when this puppet module will support it.

Change-Id: I0e6772dc22e8c27a2ffc767844c7eae12e521235

commit_message:
base-test: Gather network facts for all hosts in pre-run

Today, we do this in the validate-host role, however because we need
to access the ansible network variables in configure-unbound, that is
too late in our task process.

Because we have a fact cache by default, we can just enable the
gathering of facts when we run our first pre-run playbook, then our
validate-host role to gather then becomes a noop.

Change-Id: I9b56b3cbfd45f45a8e0d4477737f94fb0babc97c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 16:54:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use wheels when building venvs

In order to speed up the venv build process, especially
when building multiple venvs, we implement the ability
to build the wheels prior to building the venvs. Once
the wheels are built, they are pulled back to the deploy
host so that they can be re-used for the next venv build
on another host.

By default we ensure that the location separates wheels
per distribution and architecture to prevent re-use of
wheels between them which can sometimes cause problems.

Change-Id: I0c99ea8e0b57130511704659a12c904b98ba5bcd
'}, {'created': '2018-03-28 18:21:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use wheels when building venvs

to build the wheels prior to building the venvs. Once
the wheels are built, they are pulled back to the deploy

on another host.

By default we ensure that the location separates wheels
per distribution and architecture to prevent re-use of
wheels between them which can sometimes cause problems.

Change-Id: I0c99ea8e0b57130511704659a12c904b98ba5bcd

commit_message:
Use wheels when building venvs

In order to speed up the venv build process, especially
when building multiple venvs, we implement the ability
to build the wheels prior to building the venvs. Once
the wheels are built, they are pulled back to the deploy
host so that they can be re-used for the next venv build
on another host.

By default we ensure that the location separates wheels
per distribution and architecture to prevent re-use of
wheels between them which can sometimes cause problems.

Change-Id: I0c99ea8e0b57130511704659a12c904b98ba5bcd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-02 16:59:21.000000000', 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_neutron)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Unnecessary usage of test.mock_factory()
- Unnecesary setUp()
- Test data should not be accessed directly via TestData

This commit improves test/unit/api/rest/test_neutron.py.

Change-Id: I8634b0f72fe089e0da4cda8a0ba5af56ffb856c6
Partial-Bug: #1752917
'}, {'created': '2018-03-12 23:28:53.000000000', 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_cinder)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Use test_data.cinder_data
- Use response.json attribute to decode responses as much as possible

APIResourceWrapper.to_dict() method of openstack_dashboard.api.base
is changed to refer attributes of an object itself instead of
self._apiresource. There is a case where APIResourceWrapper class
defines its own attributes and such attributes should be used in
to_dict() method. If self._apiresouce is referred these attributes
are not considered. We need to consume attributes of a class object
itself. It helps us write unit tests using sample test data.

Change-Id: I8634b0f72fe089e0da4cda8a0ba5af56ffb856c6
Partial-Bug: #1752917
'}, {'created': '2018-03-13 03:29:17.000000000', 'message': 'Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_neutron)

- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Unnecessary usage of test.mock_factory()
- Unnecesary setUp()
- Test data should not be accessed directly via TestData

This commit improves test/unit/api/rest/test_neutron.py.

commit_message:
Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_neutron)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Unnecessary usage of test.mock_factory()
- Unnecesary setUp()
- Test data should not be accessed directly via TestData

This commit improves test/unit/api/rest/test_neutron.py.

Change-Id: I8634b0f72fe089e0da4cda8a0ba5af56ffb856c6
Partial-Bug: #1752917

commit_message:
Use the pbr generated wsgi binary file located in binary folder

Since pbr 1.4.0, wsgi_scripts entrypoing is supported and it will
generated a wsgi compatible binary file.

Change-Id: Ifaf069874a53fedabd252e55f5f20a9f66ba0756

commit_message:
Switch Neutron/Network API tests to mock

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test modules:
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/test_network.py
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/test_neutron.py
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_network.py
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_neutron.py

Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

Change-Id: Ib97fb1c06a883fb9fd5ce39b8fe2362a88135692

commit_message:
Improve mocking in REST API tests (test_nova)

The current REST API tests have a lot of rooms to be improved like:
- mocking the whole module of the API wrapper
- Some expected status code was 200 wrongly because mock.Mokc()
  object was returned from mocked methods. 204 is the correct
  response status code.

Change-Id: Ib3d6af27e94fb5577e259078d0215b1ace8617e1
Partial-Bug: #1752917

I'm fine with dropping the job but we need to be able to manually run the updates on stable branches in rare circumstances."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-27 05:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1 Code-Review-1

seeing discussion on #openstack-requirements, this needs more work.

will remove my WIP once requirements team gave a +1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:15:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> seeing discussion on #openstack-requirements, this needs more work.
 > 
 > will remove my WIP once requirements team gave a +1.

The patch that needs more work is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555402/ where the scripts in the check-requirements job are defined.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-27 20:26:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > seeing discussion on #openstack-requirements, this needs more
 > work.
 > >
 > > will remove my WIP once requirements team gave a +1.
 > 
 > The patch that needs more work is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555402/
 > where the scripts in the check-requirements job are defined.

All of the additional changes the requirements team asked for are in the patch series over in openstack/requirements starting from https://review.openstack.org/555403

We need to proceed with this change so that we don't end up with bot-proposed changes updating the requirements files in projects without updating lower-constraints.txt."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-27 20:29:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

ya, on further review this is fine for stable branches as long as it's communicated to the projects that this is the case.  As doug said, the fix (wich this patch depends on) is the where the real work is."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-28 05:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow -Code-Review

I expected you would not change propose_update.sh so that you can sync using this infrastructure - and then either remove the job or run the job only on stable branches. That was my interpretation of "manually sync stable changes".

If Matthew is fine and +1s this, we're fine here...'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:18:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:37:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:29:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:48:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Let's wait on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/555402/ to be really sure."}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:37:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This change should not depend on the requirements job updates.

We need to turn this job off now, so that projects do not end up merging bot proposed changes that make their requirements.txt and lower-constraints.txt files out of sync.

If we wait, then as soon as we change the requirements-check job by landing the changes in openstack/releases those projects' gates will be blocked until they sync their lower-constraints.txt list again."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-03-28 18:41:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'll enqueue this directly to the gate to save time."}]

commit_message:
remove the propose-update-requirements job

We no longer need to propose updates to projects when the global
requirements list changes, so we can remove that job.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I5a1ad5bee5758e688ce076463f297345e52bca8c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: fix typos in parameters.yaml
messages:
[{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-23 00:30:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-03-23 13:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm good with cleaning up these parameters, but I'm thinking it might make sense to comb them all for correctness/consistency in the process. For example, while I didn't notice any other obvious spelling mistakes, I did notice inconsistent use of abbreviations.

For example:
- subnet-enable_dhcp uses "dhcp" in its description, but should probably be "DHCP".
- provider:segmentation_id discussed values such as "vlan", but doesn't use formatting to indicate they are "code words" e.g. ``vlan``.
- etc.'}, {'account_id': 7715, 'date': '2018-03-27 22:49:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I agree boden's point but I think that we can solve it on another patch."}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-03-28 00:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:32:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Why another patch? This one is 4 LOC so I don't see why it wouldn't just get put into a single cleanup patch."}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-18 09:57:03.000000000', 'message': 'Be more verbose when version discovery fails

When version discovery fails, be more helpful towards the user by
including a reference to the actual exception that occured in the
error message. Add SSLError to the list of caught exceptions so that
we can log this case, too.

Change-Id: I9c26ab35d5515a937e016421e26e844212cb0bb3
Closes-Bug: 1749144
'}, {'created': '2018-03-20 14:04:12.000000000', 'message': 'Be more verbose when version discovery fails

When version discovery fails, be more helpful towards the user by
including a reference to the actual exception that occured in the
error message. Add SSLError to the list of caught exceptions so that
we can log this case, too.

Add some unit tests to verify handling of possible exceptions during
version discovery.

commit_message:
Be more helpful when version discovery fails

Modify the error message for failed discovery in an attempt to better
help the user fixing the issue.

Include a reference to the actual exception that occured in the
error message. Add SSLError to the list of caught exceptions so that
we can log this case, too.

Add some unit tests to verify the handling of possible exceptions during
version discovery.

Change-Id: I9c26ab35d5515a937e016421e26e844212cb0bb3
Closes-Bug: 1749144

commit_message:
Make differential pub-sub standard in DSE2

Differential pub-sub has been used by data sources,
but some unit tests still relied on non-differential pub-sub
being standard.

This patch makes differential pub-sub the standard to
complete the transition.

Also cleans up old transitional code. (around always_snapshot)

Change-Id: I652403df60eeb4ad19f88dfdacda893ebd381206

subject: Deprecate notify_api_faults for notify_on_api_faults
messages: [{'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-03-28 12:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:28:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-03-28 15:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 12:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate notify_api_faults for notify_on_api_faults

When Nova moved notification parameters from [DEFAULT] to
[notifications], notify_api_faults was renamed to notify_on_api_faults.
However, the Puppet code was not updated to follow this change.

This commit sets notifications/notify_on_api_faults in nova.conf,
introduces a new parameter notify_on_api_faults, and deprecates
notify_api_faults.

Change-Id: I128c716af1dc54bb13ac2c5c713f5815708a7a1a
'}, {'created': '2018-03-28 13:28:14.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate notify_api_faults for notify_on_api_faults

When Nova moved notification parameters from [DEFAULT] to
[notifications], notify_api_faults was renamed to notify_on_api_faults.
However, the Puppet code was not updated to follow this change.

This commit sets notifications/notify_on_api_faults in nova.conf,
introduces a new parameter notify_on_api_faults, and deprecates
notify_api_faults.

Change-Id: I128c716af1dc54bb13ac2c5c713f5815708a7a1a
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate notify_api_faults for notify_on_api_faults

When Nova moved notification parameters from [DEFAULT] to
[notifications], notify_api_faults was renamed to notify_on_api_faults.
However, the Puppet code was not updated to follow this change.

This commit sets notifications/notify_on_api_faults in nova.conf,
introduces a new parameter notify_on_api_faults, and deprecates
notify_api_faults.

Change-Id: I128c716af1dc54bb13ac2c5c713f5815708a7a1a

commit_message:
Dell EMC PS: Fix the driver path

The Dell EMC PS driver's path
cinder.volume.drivers.eqlx.DellEQLSanISCSIDriver is deprecated,
update to new path
cinder.volume.drivers.dell_emc.ps.PSSeriesISCSIDriver

Closes Bug: #1758133

Change-Id: Ia676610fc22da31202133497b7ed0fae66e7ac1c
(cherry picked from commit 75c62afe1098f1daa1228b372cd5ce8554fad70a)

[{'created': '2018-03-28 15:37:11.000000000', 'message': "Set glance images dir owners each time

After a deployment of Queens, glance's images directory comes up with
ownership of `root:root` when it should be `glance:glance`. This
prevents an end user from uploading an image.

This patch removes the stat check of the images directory and always
ensures the directory is created. If the directory already exists,
the create task will ensure that the directory has its ownership
set appropriately.

Closes-Bug: 1759552
Change-Id: I286d6fbdfdec932ea031916f5460710a23d68374
"}, {'created': '2018-03-28 16:25:15.000000000', 'message': "Set glance images dir owners each time

After a deployment of Queens, glance's images directory comes up with
ownership of `root:root` when it should be `glance:glance`. This
prevents an end user from uploading an image.

This patch removes the stat check of the images directory and always
ensures the directory is created. If the directory already exists,
the create task will ensure that the directory has its ownership

Closes-Bug: 1759552
Change-Id: I286d6fbdfdec932ea031916f5460710a23d68374
(cherry picked from commit 16778e29be085d7485722e1bf8a3cb2bda7c22db)

commit_message:
Set glance images dir owners each time

After a deployment of Queens, glance's images directory comes up with
ownership of `root:root` when it should be `glance:glance`. This
prevents an end user from uploading an image.

This patch removes the stat check of the images directory and always
ensures the directory is created. If the directory already exists,
the create task will ensure that the directory has its ownership
set appropriately.

Closes-Bug: 1759552
Change-Id: I286d6fbdfdec932ea031916f5460710a23d68374
(cherry picked from commit 16778e29be085d7485722e1bf8a3cb2bda7c22db)

commit_message:
Remove legacy-tempest-dsvm-cells job definition

The job is now defined in the nova repo as nova-cells-v1. This
change depends on the tip of the series of changes so the new
job name is used in nova, devstack and tempest and the legacy
job name is removed from project-config.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/549785
Change-Id: I01b31bd28b34d3dc8986fcbd2d12b1b2f5950fb7

commit_message:
libvirt: mask InjectionInfo.admin_pass

Logging network information and the admin password
for guest instances is not ideal, so let's not do it.

Change-Id: I328ba88b128c6c125e65d850ed7a6e57049dc7e2
Closes-Bug: #1737207
(cherry picked from commit 6839630e86d958dcda8585664586754d419363a7)

subject: Catch errors in release processing script
messages: [{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:12:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-28 13:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-03-28 14:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9061, 'date': '2018-03-28 17:33:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\n(Sounds like we might want to simplify this process, there's a lot of things calling other things)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 13:12:09.000000000', 'message': 'Catch errors in release processing script

The releases playbook calls process_release_requests.sh, which
calls process_release_requests.py, which calls release.sh and
make_branch.sh as necessary.

If an error happens during release.sh or make_branch.sh, the error
is propagated back to process_release_requests.py, but that script
failed to propagate the error back to process_release_requests.sh.

This could result in the job appearing to complete successfully,
while it actually failed to do anything (whatever the reason is).

Change-Id: I10e5362e4d14cb9d787cf09f62d0b67f7dce8a03
'}]
commit_message:
Catch errors in release processing script

The releases playbook calls process_release_requests.sh, which
calls process_release_requests.py, which calls release.sh and
make_branch.sh as necessary.

If an error happens during release.sh or make_branch.sh, the error
is propagated back to process_release_requests.py, but that script
failed to propagate the error back to process_release_requests.sh.

This could result in the job appearing to complete successfully,
while it actually failed to do anything (whatever the reason is).

Change-Id: I10e5362e4d14cb9d787cf09f62d0b67f7dce8a03

commit_message:
improve error handling of clone_repo

Do not explicitly return 0 at the end of the function in case set -e
doesn't work inside the function the way we expect.

Use git -C instead of a subshell.

Remove an unused variable.

Change-Id: I166563cb6e84dd5af38e11b2f69189bbf6befd0e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
check out the series branch when tagging a release

When a project is retired, the .gitreview file is removed. Without
that file, "git review -s" (run during cloning) fails, and the tag job
ends up failing.

This patch passes an assumed branch name to clone_repo.sh so that if
the stable branch for the series exists we get it. If the stable
branch does not exist, clone_repo.sh falls back to checking out
master.

Change-Id: Ib1221b5672c518eb8e3037232440807af6c90412
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fixed the problem for SSL certificate access failure

When specify OPENSTACK_SSL_NO_VERIFY = False, monascaclient
throws an exception when access alarms, alarm definitions
and notifictions.  Changed parameter cert to verify so it
takes boolean or passes the certificate file.

Also added unit tests for api.client

Story: 2001601
Task: 6555

Change-Id: Ib068bdc3fae1ebdb2bda8d7b6c24a725cef5b24b
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/550130
(cherry picked from commit c347cd2bf4f3b3f02e41f07edbf7960ff59110cd)

commit_message:
Allow meta_params and op_params on resource::ip

This should give us support for specifying custom timeouts on VIPs.
Tested with:
pacemaker::resource::ip { 'my_ip':
  ip_address   => "172.16.11.97",
  cidr_netmask => '32',
  op_params    => 'start timeout=200s stop timeout=200s monitor timeout=5s',
  tries        => 3,
}

Obtained:
[root@foobar-0 ~]# pcs resource show ip-172.16.11.97
 Resource: ip-172.16.11.97 (class=ocf provider=heartbeat type=IPaddr2)
  Attributes: cidr_netmask=32 ip=172.16.11.97
  Operations: monitor interval=60s timeout=5s (ip-172.16.11.97-monitor-interval-60s)
              start interval=0s timeout=200s (ip-172.16.11.97-start-interval-0s)
              stop interval=0s timeout=200s (ip-172.16.11.97-stop-interval-0s)

Related-Bug: #1719540

Change-Id: Iadf0cd3805f72141563707f43130945c9d362f5c

commit_message:
Fix up error code path

If we bail out via a Puppet::Error we want to print the name
of the resource that failed. Use the proper variabled for that
and not an undefined one.

Change-Id: I6d96cf7d5860cb3a96ddaa2aecf1aef8ad6ac4a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-01 08:34:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix and update compute schedulers config guide

There were several things wrong with this doc since the migration
in-tree in pike, which are handled here:

- Updated options to use the current names.
- Any mention of the periodic_task_interval option is removed
  since this doc is really about the FilterScheduler, and the
  periodic task interval is only used by the CachingScheduler to
  cache and refresh hosts, something the FilterScheduler doesn't do.
  The note about service_down_time is already covered in the help
  text for the periodic_task_interval option.
- Removed a broken (and oddly placed) link to the block storage
  docs; it's unclear why the compute scheduler docs need to randomly
  link to the block storage docs for schedluing (maybe that was
  super legacy from the nova-volume days).
- Fixed a broken link to the 'evacuate instances' docs.

This change does not get into details for the individual filters
or weighers, only the overview and filter scheduler description.

Change-Id: Ie5bb9781e1997ad12521b5df5245a78b587a4a20
Closes-Bug: #1749235
(cherry picked from commit 8be8d02aa77ebbe6687fa9ec4c74949cde0bf596)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix and update compute schedulers config guide

There were several things wrong with this doc since the migration
in-tree in pike, which are handled here:

- Updated options to use the current names.
- Any mention of the periodic_task_interval option is removed
  since this doc is really about the FilterScheduler, and the
  periodic task interval is only used by the CachingScheduler to
  cache and refresh hosts, something the FilterScheduler doesn't do.
  The note about service_down_time is already covered in the help
  text for the periodic_task_interval option.
- Removed a broken (and oddly placed) link to the block storage
  docs; it's unclear why the compute scheduler docs need to randomly
  link to the block storage docs for schedluing (maybe that was
  super legacy from the nova-volume days).
- Fixed a broken link to the 'evacuate instances' docs.

This change does not get into details for the individual filters
or weighers, only the overview and filter scheduler description.

Change-Id: Ie5bb9781e1997ad12521b5df5245a78b587a4a20
Closes-Bug: #1749235
(cherry picked from commit 8be8d02aa77ebbe6687fa9ec4c74949cde0bf596)

It has been deprecated.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-09 01:32:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

In py3, we should use asyncio instead.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-09 03:12:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> In py3, we should use asyncio instead.

Okay that's much better.  As trollius is used as a fallback when asyncio isn't available and it's available from Python 3.4[1]  I think the marker is safe to add here.


[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/asyncio.html"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-09 03:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 3ca3ec8eeea13c125e6deedfa19587b7e06ecbd2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-09 03:48:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think the question is if requirements (specifically global-reqs.txt) should be descriptive or prescriptive.

If prescriptive, we can set this as this is what we want to limit support to in openstack.
If descriptive, we do not set this as upstream officially supports py3.

I'm more inclined to be descriptive.  (so won't change my vote, but I won't block it)."}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Tony Breeds "@Victor As the maintainer for trollius can you give us you opinion? Should we still be using trollius in zaqar?"

Zaqar should drop Python2 support and replace trollius with asyncio.'}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2018-03-09 10:35:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Trollius is deprecated since its version 2.1 (2016-02-05):
https://github.com/vstinner/trollius/blob/trollius/doc/deprecated.rst

In the meanwhile, dozens of bugs have been fixed in asyncio. It doesn't make sense to use Trollius on Python 3. Only use Trollius on Python 2 if you don't have other choices :-) Trollius is not going to disappear soon, since I know that Zaqar and Gnocchi use it, but it's no longer maintained at all."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-09 22:35:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Zaqar should drop Python2 support and replace trollius with
 > asyncio.

Sure but that isn't a project decision it's community decision and right now for all branches we're on the hook for py2 support."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-09 22:38:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Trollius is deprecated since its version 2.1 (2016-02-05):
 > https://github.com/vstinner/trollius/blob/trollius/doc/deprecated.rst
 > 
 > In the meanwhile, dozens of bugs have been fixed in asyncio. It
 > doesn't make sense to use Trollius on Python 3. Only use Trollius
 > on Python 2 if you don't have other choices :-) Trollius is not
 > going to disappear soon, since I know that Zaqar and Gnocchi use
 > it, but it's no longer maintained at all.

Thanks.  Zaqar only uses Trollius on Py2 .. well actually if the asyncio module isn't available so I guess it's more accurate to say py < 3.4 ;P

We're just talking about codifying that in global-requirements to make life better for Debian Packagers.

In the longer term I guess Zaqar could look for alternatives for websockets and remove Trollius altogther"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-09 22:44:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

us stating trollius is only for python<3.5 doesn't mean that debian can't make their own packaging decisions"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-17 21:41:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

I'm okay with it, although I do wonder if there isn't an equivalent update in upper-constraints needed.."}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-19 01:52:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-19 05:31:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm okay with it, although I do wonder if there isn't an equivalent
 > update in upper-constraints needed..

Good point, it will need to be reflected in u-c.  We'll get it via the next generate-constraints merge but it should be done here to be explicit."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-03-19 05:34:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-03-19 06:34:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I am not sure, but shouldn't the l-c be updated as well?"}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-03-19 08:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> I am not sure, but shouldn't the l-c be updated as well?

Please see [1]_

[1] https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/lower-constraints.txt#L218"}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-20 07:26:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-03-20 09:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21728, 'date': '2018-03-20 09:44:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-03-22 19:40:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2018-03-23 05:52:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2018-03-23 09:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-03-25 23:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26297, 'date': '2018-03-26 00:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-03-27 20:16:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1

Idea of lower-constraints.txt was maintain a coinstallable list of lower versions. We might need to make it more useful over time.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-03-27 22:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 09:22:12.000000000', 'message': "Don't failover amphora with LB in PENDING_*

This patch updates the health manager to update the amphora_health timestamp
even if the listener count does not match if the load balancer is in PENDING_*
provisioning status. This will stop failovers for occuring on load balancers
being updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I7d483d764bd841c6977afa0bcf3227e02c573b91
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit f7f8050c1c75b6ca2367b2782c829c60e1586252)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't failover amphora with LB in PENDING_*

This patch updates the health manager to update the amphora_health timestamp
even if the listener count does not match if the load balancer is in PENDING_*
provisioning status. This will stop failovers for occuring on load balancers
being updated or deleted.

Change-Id: I7d483d764bd841c6977afa0bcf3227e02c573b91
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit f7f8050c1c75b6ca2367b2782c829c60e1586252)

Hey Oliver, again thanks for your feedback.

So, I was trying to make a sort of retention policy for the tables purge, the thing is that the cron job is static and the openstack-nova feature only takes a date as parameter.

So, for sorting this out we should improve the CLI in openstack-nova and then apply that to puppet-novva/tripleo-heat-templates'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:20:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Could try to convince Dan to change it... but can't we do this in puppet? Might have to step into ruby a bit for date manipulation though"}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:40:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hey owalsh o/ so, the thing is that we can play with ruby on the puppet manifest, but at the end it should be translated to something like:

* * * * * nova-manage db purge --before <here a date>

And that date will be fixed.. maybe we will need another parameter like --expire <n> and the number can be translated to the current date minus n days in openstack nova to purge the shadow tables.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-21 16:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Ok, from Alex feedback lets add a bash date generation command in the cron entry.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-21 17:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-03-21 17:11:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> So, I was trying to make a sort of retention policy for the tables
 > purge, the thing is that the cron job is static and the
 > openstack-nova feature only takes a date as parameter.
 > 
 > So, for sorting this out we should improve the CLI in
 > openstack-nova and then apply that to puppet-novva/tripleo-heat-templates

I'm not sure what you want other than a date. You can do this trivially:

 nova-manage db purge --before $(date -d 'now - 1 month')

and it'll purge only things more than a month old."}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-21 17:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-22 12:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from add-purge-all-cells to bp-db-cleanup topic'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-22 13:59:57.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bp-db-cleanup topic to bp-db-cleanup'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-22 14:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20775, 'date': '2018-03-22 15:09:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Proven to be installed correctly:

http://logs.openstack.org/66/551966/7/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-undercloud-oooq/bed2390/logs/undercloud/var/log/extra/installed_crons.txt.gz

1 0 * * * nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows  --max_rows 100  >>/dev/null 2>&1
0 12 * * 6 nova-manage db purge --before `date --date='today - 0 days' +%D`  >>/var/log/nova/nova-rowspurge.log 2>&1

commit_message:
Add purge to Nova cleanup cron.

This patch enable the option --purge
in the Cron cleaning the Nova deleted instances.

Also, enables the --all-cells option to
cause the purge to be applied against all cell
databases

Also adds new cron options to purge the shadow
tables daily with a 14 days retention period.

Depends-On: I2dcf37417c36fb8b1bde207c60d22d580005715c
Depends-On: I4ac0c9bd30463c546b141326b1293c78f845cf81
Depends-On: I9ffebfad1d31182f43ed688a7c1ff3047655cbae
Depends-On: Ia99cd83dae1ed35b4cb6f035c445617f1e40f490
Change-Id: I5033f9a4e2f540b9f0154e287560bd6cce412663

(1 comment)

I'm thinking you can create a test by modifying an existing on in neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py - let me take a quick look."}, {'account_id': 13998, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-03-15 15:57:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Something like this in neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_agent.py around line 2557:

    def test_process_dvr_router_if_compatible_no_ha_interface(self):
        agent = l3_agent.L3NATAgent(HOSTNAME, self.conf)
        agent.conf.agent_mode = 'dvr_snat'
        router = {'id': _uuid(),
                  'distributed': True, 'ha': True,
                  'external_gateway_info': {}, 'routes': [],
                  'admin_state_up': True}

        agent._process_router_if_compatible(router)
        self.assertIn(router['id'], agent.router_info)

        with mock.patch.object(agent, 'check_ha_state_for_router') as chsfr:
            agent._process_router_if_compatible(router)
            self.assertFalse(chsfr.called)"}, {'account_id': 13998, 'date': '2018-03-16 14:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15952, 'date': '2018-03-19 08:20:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15952, 'date': '2018-03-19 11:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-03-19 16:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you also add a functional test similar to the ones shown in the file below.
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py'}, {'account_id': 15952, 'date': '2018-03-20 17:30:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Can you also add a functional test similar to the ones shown in the
 > file below.
 > https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Good point, I should definitely add functional tests. I currently trying to understand how I would need to create test test router instances.

Function https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py#L1276 looks like a promising example to me with the following code:

 > self._setup_dvr_ha_agents()
 > self._setup_dvr_ha_bridges()
 >
 > router1 = self._create_dvr_ha_router(
 >     self.agent, enable_gw=enable_gw,
 >     enable_centralized_fip=enable_centralized_fip,
 >     snat_bound_fip=snat_bound_fip)
 > router2 = self._create_dvr_ha_router(
 >     self.failover_agent, enable_gw=enable_gw,
 >     enable_centralized_fip=enable_centralized_fip,
 >     snat_bound_fip=snat_bound_fip)

I think for my test case I would need to adapt the creation of router2 with something like 'self._create_dvr_non_ha_router', so that a router without 'ha_state' would be created. The only difference to 'self._create_dvr_ha_router' would be, that 'generate_dvr_router_info' is called with 'enable_ha=False' instead of True.

Would that be correct? Or am I missing something here and I need to setup more for my test cases?"}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-03-20 18:03:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Good point, I should definitely add functional tests. I currently trying to understand how I would need to create test test router instances.
Function https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py#L1276 looks like a promising example to me with the following code:
self._setup_dvr_ha_agents()
self._setup_dvr_ha_bridges()
 >
router1 = self._create_dvr_ha_router(
    self.agent, enable_gw=enable_gw,
    enable_centralized_fip=enable_centralized_fip,
    snat_bound_fip=snat_bound_fip)
router2 = self._create_dvr_ha_router(
    self.failover_agent, enable_gw=enable_gw,
    enable_centralized_fip=enable_centralized_fip,
    snat_bound_fip=snat_bound_fip)
I think for my test case I would need to adapt the creation of router2 with something like 'self._create_dvr_non_ha_router', so that a router without 'ha_state' would be created. The only difference to 'self._create_dvr_ha_router' would be, that 'generate_dvr_router_info' is called with 'enable_ha=False' instead of True.
Would that be correct? Or am I missing something here and I need to setup more for my test cases?
>>>>> Yes that would work."}, {'account_id': 7016, 'date': '2018-03-20 23:30:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Adding two routers in the functional test would be tricky. So just use a single dvr router and see if calls the 'check for ha state' with the given conditions."}, {'account_id': 15952, 'date': '2018-03-21 09:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Adding two routers in the functional test would be tricky. So just
 > use a single dvr router and see if calls the 'check for ha state'
 > with the given conditions.

Thanks for the suggestion. Looking into the generate_dvr_router_info() code I see one problem with this approach: Creating a dvr router with enable_ha=False will cause that router['ha'] is not set. But to test this fix we need a router with router['ha'] = True that has no ha_state. I am not sure how I can create a router with such conditions manually..."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:15:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 27707, 'date': '2018-03-21 13:31:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-03-21 19:12:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-12 17:25:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix l3-agent crash on routers without ha_state

l3-agent checks the HA state of routers when a router is updated.
To ensure that the HA state is only checked on HA routers the following
check is performed: `if router.get('ha') and not is_dvr_only_agent`.
This check should ensure that the check is only performed on
DvrEdgeHaRouter and HaRouter objects.

Unfortunately, there are cases where we have DvrEdgeRouter objects
running on 'dvr_snat' agents. E.g. when deploying a loadbalancer with
neutron-lbaas in a landscape with 6 network nodes and
max_l3_agents_per_router set to 3, it may happen that the loadbalancer
is placed on a network node that does not have a DvrEdgeHaRouter running
on it. In such a case, neutron will deploy a DvrEdgeRouter object on the
network node to serve the loadbalancer, just like it would deploy a
DvrEdgeRouter on a compute node when deploying a VM.

Under such circumstances each update to the router will lead to an
AttributeError, because the DvrEdgeRouter object does not have the
ha_state attribute.

This patch circumvents the issue by doing an additional check on the
router object to ensure that it actually has the ha_state attribute.

Change-Id: I755990324db445efd0ee0b8a9db1f4d7bfb58e26
Closes-Bug: #1755243

DvrEdgeHaRouter and HaRouter objects.

Unfortunately, there are cases where we have DvrEdgeRouter objects
running on 'dvr_snat' agents. E.g. when deploying a loadbalancer with
neutron-lbaas in a landscape with 6 network nodes and
max_l3_agents_per_router set to 3, it may happen that the loadbalancer
is placed on a network node that does not have a DvrEdgeHaRouter running
on it. In such a case, neutron will deploy a DvrEdgeRouter object on the
network node to serve the loadbalancer, just like it would deploy a
DvrEdgeRouter on a compute node when deploying a VM.

Under such circumstances each update to the router will lead to an
AttributeError, because the DvrEdgeRouter object does not have the
ha_state attribute.

This patch circumvents the issue by doing an additional check on the
router object to ensure that it actually has the ha_state attribute.

Change-Id: I755990324db445efd0ee0b8a9db1f4d7bfb58e26
Closes-Bug: #1755243

commit_message:
Fix l3-agent crash on routers without ha_state

l3-agent checks the HA state of routers when a router is updated.
To ensure that the HA state is only checked on HA routers the following
check is performed: `if router.get('ha') and not is_dvr_only_agent`.
This check should ensure that the check is only performed on
DvrEdgeHaRouter and HaRouter objects.

Unfortunately, there are cases where we have DvrEdgeRouter objects
running on 'dvr_snat' agents. E.g. when deploying a loadbalancer with
neutron-lbaas in a landscape with 6 network nodes and
max_l3_agents_per_router set to 3, it may happen that the loadbalancer
is placed on a network node that does not have a DvrEdgeHaRouter running
on it. In such a case, neutron will deploy a DvrEdgeRouter object on the
network node to serve the loadbalancer, just like it would deploy a
DvrEdgeRouter on a compute node when deploying a VM.

Under such circumstances each update to the router will lead to an
AttributeError, because the DvrEdgeRouter object does not have the
ha_state attribute.

This patch circumvents the issue by doing an additional check on the
router object to ensure that it actually has the ha_state attribute.

Change-Id: I755990324db445efd0ee0b8a9db1f4d7bfb58e26
Closes-Bug: #1755243

run both regular and multitenancy tests.

Unfortunately, this patch uncovers that we don't run any tests for
network attach/detach in practice. The devstack plugin has to be updated
first to support more than one port per node. A TODO is left in the playbook.

Change-Id: I46d94c29f858977604c0a3430257eca2bee977e3

commit_message:
Gate: run ironic tests in the regular multinode job

We don't specify any regex for this job, so it runs some tests.
They only include test_network_basic_ops, which does not check that
multitenancy is in effect. We have a test for it in ironic-tempest-plugin,
but it does not run anywhere. There is a neutron test for the same,
but it's not a smoke test and it has been skipped for quite some time.

This change switches this job to the run the following tests:
* all ironic tests (that are not skipped for any reason)
* multinode tests from Nova

Unfortunately, this patch uncovers that we don't run any tests for
network attach/detach in practice. The devstack plugin has to be updated
first to support more than one port per node. A TODO is left in the playbook.

Change-Id: I46d94c29f858977604c0a3430257eca2bee977e3

commit_message:
Add --by-service to discover_hosts

This allows us to discover and map compute hosts by service instead of
by compute node, which will solve a major deployment ordering problem for
people using ironic. This also allows closing a really nasty race when
doing HA of nova-compute/ironic.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/cli/nova-manage.rst

NOTE(danms): Conflicts in nova-manage.rst due to queens not having recent
             changes to the man page.

Change-Id: Ie9f064cb9caf6dcba2414acb24d12b825df45fab
Closes-Bug: #1755602
(cherry picked from commit 005a66d7e0bb716e32d29a6b5c9d9f24192596e2)

commit_message:
remove OS::TripleO::Services::CephClient from CephAll

CephClient should be removed from the CephAll role.
The only thing it does is the key set which is already
handled by the ceph mon profile.
if not will cause Duplicate declaration: Class[Ceph::Keys]

Change-Id: I77bbec1edd21cd6a4212a381a1a7712adc4b604f
Related-Bug: 1722633

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-21 19:44:00.000000000', 'message': 'Preserve multiattach flag when refreshing connection_info

When we attach a multiattach-capable volume, we do something
dirty and stash a "multiattach" boolean flag in the
BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info dict. This is used by the
virt driver to determine how to connect the volume (for the
libvirt driver, it sets the "shareable" element on the disk
config xml).

When resizing an instance, ComputeManager._finish_resize on
the destination host refreshes the block device mapping list
along with the connection_info for each BDM. Because of this,
it would overwrite the BDM.connection_info along with the stashed
"multiattach" flag which is later used to connect the volumes
on the destination host via the virt driver.finish_migration
method. This leads to failures with multiattach volumes because
the disk config is wrong.

To fix this, when refreshing BDM connection_info, we preserve
the multiattach flag in the connection_info, similar to the
serial (volume ID) and multipath_id.

Interestingly enough, the nova-multiattach job does not fail
the volume multiattach resize test with libvirt 1.3.1 and qemu
2.5. This failure was only noticed once the nova-multiattach
job was tested with libvirt 4.0.0 and qemu 2.11.1. So maybe there
was something in the older package versions that masked this
obvious bug in the nova code.

Change-Id: Iaee13478212cc04e6d1a1249f33822369d94d41d
Closes-Bug: #1757190
(cherry picked from commit 5f3cca205581d45d92714ce1a909d4394b7812ff)
'}]
commit_message:
Preserve multiattach flag when refreshing connection_info

When we attach a multiattach-capable volume, we do something
dirty and stash a "multiattach" boolean flag in the
BlockDeviceMapping.connection_info dict. This is used by the
virt driver to determine how to connect the volume (for the
libvirt driver, it sets the "shareable" element on the disk
config xml).

When resizing an instance, ComputeManager._finish_resize on
the destination host refreshes the block device mapping list
along with the connection_info for each BDM. Because of this,
it would overwrite the BDM.connection_info along with the stashed
"multiattach" flag which is later used to connect the volumes
on the destination host via the virt driver.finish_migration
method. This leads to failures with multiattach volumes because
the disk config is wrong.

To fix this, when refreshing BDM connection_info, we preserve
the multiattach flag in the connection_info, similar to the
serial (volume ID) and multipath_id.

Interestingly enough, the nova-multiattach job does not fail
the volume multiattach resize test with libvirt 1.3.1 and qemu
2.5. This failure was only noticed once the nova-multiattach
job was tested with libvirt 4.0.0 and qemu 2.11.1. So maybe there
was something in the older package versions that masked this
obvious bug in the nova code.

Change-Id: Iaee13478212cc04e6d1a1249f33822369d94d41d
Closes-Bug: #1757190
(cherry picked from commit 5f3cca205581d45d92714ce1a909d4394b7812ff)

commit_message:
Don't use custom password generating code

Consolidate code that generates password strings
in drivers.

Just a cleanup/hardening measure.

Change-Id: Icd34077bbf1ccdee3475ba17ab3a52d8ad34e821

commit_message:
Change launchpad to StoryBoard

We're using StoryBoard to track features and bugs, instead
of Launchpad [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/ironic/2018/ironic.2018-03-26-15.00.html

Change-Id: I0af1c937da64c271de80939b5359db86b837b607

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8d773d4ee3d0835fb2a9183fe2154e82db085bd5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8a5c47cb8e4d623776cd4335754184f6f7f0d398
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8a5c47cb8e4d623776cd4335754184f6f7f0d398
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
